reviews.review: Stunning..... Stunning architecture, glass, mirrors, chandeliers, woodwork, everything. Fabulous cafe with excellent cakes and coffee.

Booking in advance is mandatory!!. I was disappointed when I came here because the guided tour was fully booked until Friday (I went on Wednesday). Nevertheless, the architecture and the design interior in the lobby were amazing. One of the best example of art nouveau in Prague.

Art-Nouveau masterpiece. This building is an outstanding example of Art-Nouveau architecture. The external features, especially the mosaic fronting the Republic Square, are superb, but there are real jewels inside. Do a guided tour if you can. If you can get to a concert in the Smetana Hall, which takes up the centre of the building, you're in for a real treat. The ceiling is wonderful. There's a cafe and a restaurant off the main entrance, which each have wonderful ambiance, especially the restaurant. Go there for a romantic dinner in superb, turn-of-the-20th-century surroundings.

you must see this place! it belongs to the "people". Astounding building and history - take a tour if you can ... We were able to get into the "private rooms" which are just the most stunning bits of architecture, furnishings, tapestries, fabrics, etc. ... An orchestra was practicing Smetana during our tour in the main concert hall and, while we couldn't go in it, you could peek through the door and hear the music in the hallway. Learn about this building - inside and out!

Stunning Examples of Art Nouveau.. This is a true stunner in Prague. We took the tour (which was in English) and it was absolutely some of the best time we spent in Prague. The guide was extremely knowledgeable and provided an in-depth overview of each of the rooms we visited.This is truly something to see so definitely consider taking the tour. Each of the rooms was absolutely stunning from the smallest to the grand auditorium. There are also concerts nearly every evening and while we did not partake would definitely take one in during our next visit.
Obecni Dum. The most beautiful building in Prague. Everything in this building is breathtaking. All Jugendstil details. Drink a coffee, go to a concert: you won't be disappointed

An Art Something Masterpiece. I take it we are talking about the Obecni Dům? This is one of the highlights of Prague in terms of ambience. Don't miss it. Only thing, they don't do cocktails in the cafe, but they do do nice cake.

A beautiful building from the outside. We did not go into this building except the entrance area. There are restaurants and also a concert hall. Well worth seeing the outside of this magnificent building
Concerts available everyday. A enjoyable concert at Municipal house. The architecture of the building is also very stunning. Some wall painting are from Mucha!

A lovely example of art nouveau. We were here many years ago when the building was open and you free to walk about. Now it has been broken up into theater and other cultural venues so you must take a tour to see the interior spaces. I think it is worth it for the interior architecture with its classic art nouveau details. The gift shop has regional items for sale but is more tourist oriented now. The cafes are crowded but wonderful interior spaces.

DO NOT EVEN CONSIDER A CONCERT HERE. Total scam. They sell you a ticket for the grand hall, only to find the show is actually a group of amateurs performing in a side room. The best part is that customers who ask for a refund are abused, sworn at and threatened by the little rat in the ticket booth. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Stunnig. What an insight into times gone by. Just go and be overawed by the architecture. Wonderful gift shop with excellent selections.

Outstanding Art Nouveau. If you are interested in art and architecture, especially that of the turn of 19th–20th centuries, the visit to the Municipal house is a must. Besides, if you go there, another important sightseeing object is right at the corner and that is Powder Tower, a remnant of ancient city wall. Additionally, if walk a bit around, there will be even more excellent examples of the architecture of turn of 19th–20th centuries.
Very nice. Nice place in a beauty area.Good place for photos and hanging around.Generally all the city is whole Beauty!

Beautiful. We went to a classical concert here. The tickets were easy to purchase and options well explained. The theatre was beautiful and performance delightful. Plenty of ushers to help tourists. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

Nice Art Nouveau. This is an imposing Art nouveau building at the edge of the Old town. Mostly used for concerts and exhibitions.You can go in and visit it free (limited) or take a tour. A big and stylish restaurant is on the ground floor (normal prices) to have a drink or eat. If that's not your style, right in front of it is a square with authentic food stalls offering various Czech food.

Great tour in English of beautiful, historic building. Here is a crowd-beater for you! This historic building is just far enough off the tourist path that most of them don't make it there. You can look into parts of the beautiful Art-Deco building without a tour. I want to, however, highly recommend the tour. We saw main performance space and lots of the back spaces within the building. The tour guide really brought it to life and also spoke to the historical events that took place in and near to building.

Beautiful art and history that still shapes our present. This building has a long governmental history that will interest all historians while also entertaining and exhillerating that art and fashion admirers.The guides are very knowledgeable and always infuse a touch of humor in the tour.If you are saddened by the fact that your home cannot have a Mucha painting or designed ceiling, you can drown your sorrows in a delicious French dessert and coffee in the accompanying restaurant next door.

Beautiful decor and excellent attractions. When you see the building from the street, you go WOW. Inside the beautiful decor continues in two restaurants with interior stained glass windows and crystal chandeliers. The concert hall continues all that. Time for a performance.

An architectural treasure!!! The facade just gives you a peek of more to come.. If you have an appreciation for Art Nouveau, absolutely don't miss taking a guided tour of the Municipal House. When making reservations for the tour, also book a concert in Smetana Hall and arrive early to eat at one of 3 restaurants on the premises. It is a complete package in my estimation. We ate in the lowest level restaurant with low pricing and thought the meal was excellent. If you eat the evening meal, there is rousing folk music. The guided tour takes 1 hour and walks you through Smetana Concert Hall and 6-8 salons, each unique and gorgeously Art Nouveau-designed by different artists. Be sure to look out the windows in the Alfonse Mucha decorated room. This is my second time to see this treasure. Tickets were only available within 10 days of your visit. The schedule in not consistent (Ex: not always M-Tu-Sat-Sun). My guess would be that the tour guides are retired, supporters of this wonderful structure and they sign up when they can be available. If you want to take photos inside you must pay extra and they give you a yellow tag to wear. If you don't take photos you will regret your decision.

Breathtaking!!!. If you want to see one of the few true remaining masterpieces of Art Nouveau, then you don't want to miss this. Wander the halls and staircases for a window into the past. The lamps and ceiling are full of rich detail. Take it slow and enjoy. Gift shop is in the basement.

A splendid piece of Art Nouveau architecture. Prague has a number of "art nouveau" buildings. It is surprising that they are still there after the communist regime period. One such building is the Municipal House Hall. The foyer and restaurants are all excellent examples of the style. Another building is the Imperial Palace Hotel which is just down the road. The building/s are well maintained, so it is a joy to view them in their splendour.

Great Art Nouveau building with impressive interiors and also restaurant to have a meal. Prague has some marvelous Art Nouveau buildings and this is the one, which is also available to visit. As well as you can have a meal there.

Beautiful Art Nouveau building - inside & out.. We had dinner here - very nice food at reasonable price (considering the building in a capital city), in the Art Nouveau dining room. Then went to a concert in the Smetana Hall - wonderful , and well worth the experience. Concert slightly more then you might pay in the UK, but what an experience!

Very nice building and music hall.. The building is interesting because it houses three restaurant and a concert hall.We went to a concert with the North Czech Philharmony Teplice.The orchestra was conducted by a guest conductor names Gustav Mak from Hongkong. I do not wish to comment on the solists. That is for music experts butI found the acoustics of the music hall not good, and so was the Bohemium grand piano. We were seated row 13 (VIP places) were the sound was not optimal.After the intermission we took seats at the side and the sound quality improved.
Grand old buidling. Great for people watching, See this grand old building that helps you understand the yester year of Prague. Great nouveau building see it inside and out

Excellent for appreciation of Prague life and people watching. This is a great location near an old city gate. It is across the street from a concert hall and a hub for tour bookings. The outside seating area is a must for people watching and gaining a sense of how Prague life bustles. We stopped twice, had drinks and snacks. Prices were reasonable, drinks were generous and the food was very good. But the real benefit comes from the atmosphere and people on the street. Make sure you also tour the hall it is beautiful.

Great Art Nouveau with a Czech Flair. Just wander around. Go downstairs, enjoy the tile work, peek into the restaurants even if you don't eat there. Go around to the back--even the service entrance is magnificent.

Dvořák Symphony Orchestra is a complete scam. While the building is beautiful, PLEASE do not waste your money on any performance by the con artists that call themselves the Dvořák Symphony Orchestra. For $60, I wasted an hour of my life watching in complete disbelief the "musicians" playing Canon in D, literally something a 5-year-old can play, and NOT EVEN HAVE IT MEMORIZED. PLEASE, this is an insult to everyone who isn't tone deaf or has any idea what music is. Completely amateurs at music but masters of conning tourists.

If you only see one thing in Prague, make it the Municipal Hall. This is such a lovely example of Art Nouveau architecture with details everywhere; light fixtures, furniture, even floor tiles. Plan an evening in the beautiful Smetana Hall to hear beautiful classical music. There is a charming "beer hall" restaurant and the American Bar in the basement with prices less than the main restaurant. However, arrive before 6 when the large tour groups come to dine.

Beautiful but can be a tourist trap .... I went to purchase a ticket for performance at 8 pm and I was told it was sold out so they sold me another lone without mentioning anything ... It turned out the performs exactly I was told was in a small room (NOT THE MAIN SMETANA HALL I wanted to see)...I realized after the fact that it was cheaper but it was still money I spent !!! Be careful in Prague they will sell you air if they could!

JT. This is an outstanding building which is situated on the site of the Royal Court, and situated close to Powder Gate. The level of detail includes intricate artwork and well chosen paintings and sculptures. The restaurants and cafes alongside the entrance can be compared to walk-in museums of art nouveau design. Well worth spending a lazy afternoon, and taking in the atmosphere.

Nice coffee and cake in the heart of Prague. The service at this coffee shop was very nice. The waiter was able to speak German and offered us also some nice cake and coffee. The interior design was just amazing.Prices were ok and the food was delicious.When you're in Prague, you have to go here!
Concert. started and ended exactly on time, music was magical and glad we decided to go , the bldg is incredible and the string orchestra very professional and an authentic Czech Experience

Enjoyable evening concert. We attended an evening concert here in Smetana Hall and enjoyed it immensely. We went mid-week so the crowd was small which was a plus in my book! The concert lasted approximately an hour which was also good for us as we were tired after a long day of walking around. The dress code was varied but most people were dressed in nicer casual attire. The building was clean and the staff friendly.

Art Nouveau Gem. Prague is packed with architectural treasures and this is one of the top. It is a public concert and performance hall and you can see the main rooms if you attend a concert. The tour gives you a more leisurely and extensive view with good background information. The Mucha and other art work is gorgeous. After the tour have a coffee or lunch in the cafe and enjoy the elegant details.

A great art nouveau era building. Another gem in this city of extreme architecture, with Alfonso Mucha influences. A drink in the bar was a treat (if we had waited another half hour it was 'happy hour' but we were on holiday and that didn't matter. Well worth a visit. Found out about it by visiting the Mucha Museum ealier.

Art Nouveau Building. You cannot access much of this building without a ticket to the show, but the parts that are accessible are an interesting example of Art Nouveau. Worth a peak inside just to see the beautiful restaurants. No need to spend more than 20 minutes or so poking around.

A Remarkable Building. We were waiting for our Tour. Meeting place next to the yellow booth opposite this beautiful building. We had time to spare so we entered, only to discover a lovely restaurant and bill boards advertising distinguished operas and concerts. The building is remarkable on the exterior and interior. Look up, to the roof and see those great decorations. In the evening we passed it again. It was gracefully illuminated, giving it a magical character.

The most beautiful house ever made.. Its incredible that Czech Republic still chares this gem with the public. To see this house over and over again gives inspiration and hope that beautiful things can still be built even 100 years later perhaps.

Amazing building. This building is impressive and beautiful both outside and inside, they hold many concerts and performances here which I imagine would be out of this world. You can visit the inside of the building and the bars and restaurants free of charge, these are beautifully decorated and all different. You can also take a tour which has to be booked in advance which allows you to enter some of the rooms within the building. Worth a visit.

Simply the best. This lovely Art Deco building houses a magnificent concert hall. The chairs are wooden and a bit hard so as to not compromises the acoustics. Beside they won't lot you nod off. It seems they mostly schedule full concerts not the confection of classic hits so often seen in these tourist oriented cities.

Great place to attend performance. Attended a symphony performance this week. This is an awesome way to see the building (I did not go on the tour, so I cannot compare). Booking tickets online was quite easy and they were very reasonably priced (compared to the US). This was one of the highlights of the trip to Prague!

Prague, a magical city. Being in Prague is like having stepped into a fairy tale. The architecture is amazing.My most favorite building is the Municipal Hall. Built in Art Nouveau style it is absolutely gorgeous. They have tours, if you wish to see some of the rooms inside this building. It's worth it. My favourite place to have a coffee is the restaurant in this building, because of its stunning decor and it has a nice terrace.Cross over the bridge to the other side of Prague where you can visit the palace. It is a completely different world there. To me the energy there also felt different. Whereas the downtown core was bustling, happy and lively, I found this part of Prague quite somber.For excursions I can recommend a daytrip to Cesky Krumlov, a quaint village with a beautiful castle, and Kutna Hora where it is Halloween every day in the Bone Chapel. Amazing what one can do with skeletons and skulls! Also visit John Lennon's Wall.

AMAZING PLACE with two restaurants and an American Bar. This is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city. It was, and still is a public hall for concerts which is stunningly beautiful in design, and has a lot of rooms that were done for the entertaining of the social elite of the city. These are still in use and are decorated in impeccable modern taste from the beginning of the 20th century and have been meticulously restored. There is an entire room painted by Alfons Mucha, a very important Czech artist that if you don't know about you should get acquainted with in Prague where you can see some of his best work and there is a whole museum dedicated to him, also very much worth visiting.The restaurants are FABULOUS, both in looks and the food which is delicious and very particularly the pastries.Last but not least is teh first American-Style bar in Europe where ladies could walk in unaccompanied. It is a jewel of Art Deco you should not miss

Gorgeous!. An Art Nouveau treasure. The building is gorgeous inside and out. Stained glass windows, light fixtures, tiles, etc. The restaurant looked yummy - if I had been hungry at the time, I definitely would have eaten there.

Beautiful Building. I took an English language tour of this beautiful Art Nouveau building. If you’re interested in design, it’s well worth it to take this tour. The interior is stunning.The tour guide was okay. She had a lot of facts and it was a bit dry. However, I can see how it was difficult to fit in all the information in the time.I bought the additional photo pass to allow me to take photos inside. Apparently, that didn’t seem to matter since everybody was taking photos. So, I wouldn’t buy that again. However, I don’t know if they would enforce the photo pass on another tour.

An Art Nouveau gem. Wow! This place is totally beautiful - especially if you are a fan of Art Nouveau. Absolutely recommend you take some time to have a coffee in a cafe or a drink in the cocktail bar in the basement. Then you can sit and enjoy the detail of the beauty around you. And if you really want to spend some time there, spring for the expensive Art Nouveau restaurant on the first floor. If that is too rich for your pocket book, the other restaurant in the basement is pretty nice as well..

Stunning!. I have visited the Municipal Hall for a couple of different occasions, including a conference opening, and it is truly stunning. The ceiling are of particular beauty and are worth an evening trip. Do visit!
Beautiful building. We had a reception here. Beautiful building. Very good to visit if you are nearby. Not really amazing though so do not bother if you are not in the area.

Art Nouveau Beauty. Prague's most prominent Art Nouveau building does not disappoint. Mucha is everywhere in this beauty. If you're attending a concert as we did go early and take pictures. With its intricate stonework, gold trimmings,frescoes and stained glass windows, it is absolutely stunning. And it boasts the largest concert hall in Prague and a huge glass dome.It makes me a little sad that this site was originally the Royal Court Palace where the King of Bohemia once lived. But since they demolished that building (imagine what IT looked like) in the early 20th century and built this one instead, we have to be happy with the beauty this building gives us.
Interesting building. This building houses a theatre as well as exhibitions and restaurants. Outside seating is nice in the sunshine. Food is traditional.
Gorgeous art nouveau experience. Guided tour in English. One hour long with every room another gem. Not to be missed. Right in the heart of the old city.

beautiful building, excellent acoustics. We toured this building, which has room after room of beautiful fixtures. It is used for weddings, meetings etc. The main concert hall has gorgeous acoustics - we heard a wonderful concert there.
Lovely to see even just from the outside. Very pretty building. We didn't go in but it was just lovely to see. It shines in the sun light and its very grand looking.

Art Noveau Treasure. I booked a tour of the building and paid the voucher to take photos. This was about 310 crowns - about £10 pound. Lasted an hour and was awesome for anyone who delights in the joys of art noveau design. Every room is different, every one a delight. Then there are the beautiful cafes at the entrance and the Americy bar in the lower floors. The only criticism I have is the tour is a little rushed. Of course there are the concerts and attending one of these would be the icing on the cake.

Wonderful!. What a way to set the tone for our all too brief stay. An eight piece string orchestra of professional musicians performing an hour of greatest classical hits in a beautiful art nouveau building with amazing acoustics.

Beautiful place and fantastic food. Such a beautiful place and so pleasant to eat there. The food and service are excellent. The cost of the food is good, coffee and cake was about 200k and a full meal was about 10 UK pounds depending on what you have,

Another must see. Beautifully maintained.Up the stairs we were treated to a musical even(pre-arranged).Listening to the organ being played - the sound was magical. The acoustics were good. We then went on a guided tour of the rooms in the building.

Free to enter. To enter the building was free and there was a stand on which they sold tickets to the evening concerts and symphonies. We really did want to go and attend one of the events but we were extremely short of time and we missed it. I hared from a local that the restaurant is not were good but rather over priced. There was a roof top bar a few minutes walk from there called the T-anker which we found really nice. It was open from 11 to 11.

Czech Music Orchestra is good but a little expensive for what it is. My wife and daughter paid about 80 Euros to attend this concert. Given the price, they had anticipated a full orchestra, but in fact the group is basically a string quartet with a few extra violins. Given the modest audience size they were in a smaller room, but the acoustics were fantastic and the musicians top level professionals. The programme was top popular classics eg Dvorak Humoresque in Gb major, and lasted about an hour. The music was really good, and I would have given 4 or 5 stars but for the price and the vaguaries of the word 'orchestra'.

A Mucha masterpiece. Beautifully preserved Art Nouveau building with lush interior design by Alphonse Mucha. Smetana Hall has concerts; several restaurants occupy space and when we visited there was a second-floor exhibition of fine crafts and textiles of the same period from the collection of the Design Museum (which appeared to be closed).The decor itself is worth a visit.in the Old Town.

Representative house that really represents. Built in the space of medieval royal residence, on the border of the Old and the New Town, before the WWI. it is an exceptional example of art deco. It houses not only the largest concert hall in Prague, and coffee house and restaurants with period cutlery but a beer hall and the American bar, as it looked in 1908. To descend there you can use stairs, with walls decorated by tiles from the factory that still exists and has the original dies for them, or you can use the art deco elevator .
Obecni Dum. I alredy enjoy old design and meal. Restaurant is little expensive then I drink there coffe with desert.

Iconic Prague Restaurant. This beautiful, Art Deco eatery shines with history! Beautiful, unique lighting and interesting Windows and wood trim make this space very special! The luncheon, "Tourist Special", cannot be missed! The history of the Hall, where Famous political dignitaries met for functions, is also unique!

Beautiful Art Nouveau at it's best. Ii always point my friend here as first port of call, go get afternoon tea, with cake in the most beautiful Art Nouveau surroundings. take a peak in at the lifts in the foyer and downstairs to the amazing American bar - you can imagine the long silver gowns and cigarette holders while sipping cocktails, enchanting! The tour isn't expensive and well worth the money, Mucha's room is a favourite of mine. The restaurant is one of the best examples of Art Nouveau dining rooms. Food is OK, but you can't beat the experience.
Superb. As amazing a site as I've ever seen. Nouveau in incredible condition. Fine guide as well. I would recommend it highly. Go immediately!

An unexpected treat. The Municipal House had not featured on our "must do" list, but it was well worth a visit. It's very beautiful - I loved the peacock curtains, and the ceilings. It's also functional and well used.

Beautiful building and a lovely cafe. We went for tea and cake in the cafe - it was a very nice experience as I felt like I was in a movie! Beautiful setting, cakes were being shown around in a cake trolley. Cakes were average but it was the experience that counts! We also enjoyed the music that a pianist was playing.

Impressive Art Deco building. It's well worth the stroll up from the Charles Bridge to Municipal Hall through some of the newer retail precincts, although almost always surrounded by a mix of old world buildingsMunicipal Hall houses a good tea house and an upmarket resturant, plus a concert hall whose entrance is clad in marble-impressive and well maintained.Unfortunately no tours available when we visited but would be worthwhile to get properly inside

A scam, una fregatura. We had the same bad experience as other people: we bought 2 tickets expecting to see a concert in the concert hall. Instead, we were sent downstairs into the basement and then into a small room, we felt VERY mislead. The photos at the box office depicted a magnificent auditorium. We complained before the concert started and the guy was very rude, did not care at all and refused to help in any way.Do not go, do not waste your money and time.

Really impressive place to go and take a look around. Went to have a look around the building and it is stunning, would highly recommend it if you have the time. Well looked after and really pretty inside.

The guided tour is worth it. The building is beautiful, unique, and historic. The guided tour is worth the price (though they do that odd thing where you have to pay additional to take photos). The guide was nice, the tour moved at a good pace: enough information, but never got boring. And the rooms are worth seeing, especially the Mucha lounge walls. Enjoy a drink downstairs after, it's fun and well priced (and a great Art Deco bar)!

Take the tour! Spectacular!. This was among my top three things to see and do on our two week tour of Berlin and Prague. But, you really need to take the tour! You are taken into many amazing and beautiful rooms in the Municipal House Hall that you would not otherwise see and told about the significance and purpose of each room. By the way, "Municipal House Hall" is a terrible name for this building. It should be called "Awesomely Beautiful Hall" or something. If you can't take a tour, at least wander around as much as possible but, oh heck, just TAKE THE TOUR! This building is a splendid example of the Art Nouveau style of architecture and decorating.

Surprisingly interesting. A gem amidst the busy streets of Prague. If you like the art deco style then the tour is well worth doing. Plus a visit to the cafe for a drink and cake accompanied by a pianist. A pleasant surprise all round

Art Nouveau Experience. One of the iconic building of Old Town Prague which each tourist should visit. You can enjoy classic music concerts as well as exlusive selection of restaurants. My favourite is french restaurant located in ground floor of the building. Food Quality and service is really excellent. Price is slightly above average but affordable.
Municipla House. One of the most beautiful building in Prague was lucky to have tickets to a concert inside. The building is amazing.All marble and mosaic.

Homage To Prague...Not to be missed. Municipal House - or as the Czechs call it Obecni Dum or Representacni Dum ( REPRE for short).You can choose to come for a concert in The Smetana Hall, or visit one of the three restaurants, or a bar. The beautiful Ballroom with the glass dome ceiling is why I used to come here with my friends during my school days - to dance the night away. A prom night or a winter ball was a highlight to be enjoyed in this building, in the Soviet era. The facade of the building was much neglected during those days, but the interior with its massive chandeliers and beautiful artwork still managed to shine brightly. To access most of what is to be admired inside the building is limited to taking a tour. While I am not a fan of taking tours, especially not in Prague, it may be a good option for you. The premises up a flight of stairs are otherwise roped off.Obviously the restaurants that are housed to both sides of the lobby and one flight down are a good experience, most of the time, and a great way to enjoy the fabulous and historically important Art Nouveau building. The terrace outside is a nice place to watch the world go by. Don't miss the beautifully restored mosaic above the entrance named - Homage to Prague- set between the two groups of allegorical statues symbolizing the Degradation and Resurrection of the People.REPRE was and still is one of my favorite places in Prague.I never miss it...You should not miss it either...
What a wonderful building. Art Nouveau at every turn. A beautiful building and magnificently decorated. Wander the halls and peek into the restaurants to see the wonderful decoration. A must see.

Blanka Matragi exhibition. We went to see the above exhibition of the designer based in Lebanon born in Prague. It was an inspiration and a feast for the eyes in the amount of detail, beauty and splendour that went into each dress as well as the amount of work it took to complete. The price paid for entrance was well worth it.It building itself was very well presented and steeped in history.

Wonderful food. Members of our group went to a concert here and we had out final meal together in the elegant graceful dining room. The food was tasty and beautifully presented. A pianist entertained us as well. A memorable evening.
if you like art noveau.... This is the place to go! Beautiful architecture and restaurant in the lower level is exceptional for its beauty and the food is good, too.
Wonderful atmosphere, Excellent food. The interior of the restaurant is beautiful with murals, a musician playing an accordion. The food was excellent, traditional dishes. Sevice was also excellent.

A MUST SEE in Prague. No visit to Prague would be complete without a visit to the Municipal House. The architecture and design are magnificent and unique and the building houses several great venues. If you do nothing but walk by, it will be worth it. The structure and exterior decoration are beautiful. But definitely at least go inside and walk around as every square inch and design feature is unique and delightful. From the doorknobs, to light fixtures, to the tile work and decoration, they really went all out in creating this and it is nothing less than a magnificent artistic achievement. The MH houses a variety of famous concert venues and restaurant/bars. We attended an evening concert in Smetana Hall that we booked online in the US prior to our trip. This was actually unnecessary and there were plenty of tickets available and open seats for our show and many other similar concerts bookable the same day. The concert performance was fine - a capable string quartet playing a short selection of classics and a few interesting numbers - but the experience of being in this historic and beautiful hall really made it special. After the show we went down to the Americky Bar - basically deserted that evening - and had a wonderful old-school cocktail bar experience. The decor in there was particularly amazing and the cocktails and service were really first class - highly recommended. The Municipal House has a lot going on and should definitely be on your short list for things to see in Prague.
Beautiful. It is a very beautiful building and I had the opportunity to go to a wonderful concert there, which was a part of the Proms in Prague.
must visit. Should visit this area after dark, they lit this building beautifully and its a perfect place to take pictures

Hallowed ground of Prague's art nouveau. The Municipal House (Obecni Dum) is a stunning example of aft nouveau (jugenstil) design and decoration. A fine dining room and al fresco dining area overlooks busy Namesti Republiky.

Great experience. We only visited the café: Very attentive wait staff and good service... It's a great experience and the hot chocolate is fantastic. The raspberry cheesecake was also pretty decent. Rather expensive for Prague, and very... interesting décor. A must-see spot. I'd recommend the hot chocolate with rum, as it's a little thick for my taste on its own, and the rum adds a fantastic flavor profile.

The tour is a must. Don't be deterred by the dull name for this building, which is an under-appreciated palace. Though you can look inside at ground floor level (and access the restaurants and bars) if you have the slightest interest in Art Nouveau you should pay for a guided tour. In addition to the main concert hall, which is a sight to behold, you are taken round a number of other function rooms with a variety of early 20th century decoration. From memory, tours in English take place once or twice a day and last just under an hour. The cost is modest.

Stunning building.. Located next to the awesome Powder Tower ,the Municipal House Hall is a stunning piece of architecture which separates the New Town from the Old Town. The building looks magnificent and is a great tourist destination. It's a concert hall also .The art deco design looks superb and it's certainly one of the most beautiful buildings in Prague. Very easy to locate in Namesti Republiky which is a fantastic area of Prague packed with pubs bars and restaurants and also some fabulous architecture. Well worth checking out.

Art Nouveau and Rococo to the max!. We enjoyed a concert (Angelique Kidjo with the Czech Symphony) in this building, and what an experience. Great acoustics, fantastic art and design. A high point of our visit. Outside, an amazing musician played long-stem wine glasses filled with water as if it was a vibraphone, playing complex classical pieces in the common square with art Nouveau windows and famous interiors of Mucha in the background. If there is no concert, at least take a look at the concert hall then stop in the cafe to be surrounded by art nouveau as you sip on a latte.

It's an Opera House. The name belies this structure. Beautifully constructed. Why it's called a Municipal Building is beyond me. It can be toured, but be sure you get tickets in advance they sell out quickly, we aware unable to get tour tickets. This is located near the Powder Tower and is also a tourist magnet. This area is a gateway to the famous square.

Great inside. You need to go inside here, either attend a concert or go to one of the exhibitions, to see the gorgeous art nouveau interiors and staircase properly. Also a great place to have breakfast or coffee in style in the ground floor cafe.

Cocktails. This is a fabulous building. Very nice architecture with eye for detail.We did not have diner here or listen to a concert although this is something really enjoyable. We went down to the oldest American Bar of europe and had nice cocktails.We liked it that much that we did it twice.

Musical Experience. We booked a concert well in advance but when we turned up for the show it was about 15% full. The music was great and the concert hall was beautiful. After the concert we visited the restaurant in the basement which took you back in time in terms of decor.

Amazing place for dinner!. The hall is beautiful, service is so so but definitely worth visiting. The beer hall is big, loud and steeped in history. Live accordion music and impromptu local singers once they have had enough to drink!
Overated. Beer hall restaurant. Entertainment was only average. Beer was good, food only so-so. Would not go back. But building was gorgeous.
Beautiful architecture. Very near the city center the municipal house hall is a quite distinctive building, very adorned and quite spectacular.

Charming concert in an iconic venue. The municipal hall is a fabulous art deco building- a world apart from the image created by the title Municipal Hall. We enjoyed a short concert- just as well it was short, because the seating is less than comfortable!

BEAUTIFUL BULDING. One of the highlights of old town.. I spent time taking photo's from many angles of the fantastic exterior. Next, walk inside. as you have free access to the lobby and the basement leading to a beautiful old bar. Superbly decorated.

Most worthy tour. If you go to the concert you will only see the main concert hall. Thie one hour guided tour takes you to all the three halls and amazingly decorated side rooms in different designs. You don't want to miss this one.

Art Nouveau masterpiece in an eclectic location. I am in love with this building. It is beautifully conceived and excellently executed with the top-most Czech skill and accuracy. Perfectly maintained and fully in use serving the public of Prague. Add to that the other buildings of numerous architectural styles surrounding the Namesti Republiky. A must-see and do.

Beautiful Art Nouveau building, watch out for the exhibitions inside. I personally think Prague should be at least as much about its Art Nouveau (not to be confused with Art Deco) legacy as it is about Charles the IVth and in this respect you can't miss the Municipal House hall. If you're lucky enough to visit while there is an exhibition, go. There was one about Art Nouveau precisely when we were there, with pieces from a local museum (furniture, paintings, posters...) and it was absolutely empty while the Charles bridge was 150% packed. And exhibitions give you access to the floors of the building, allowing to see other marvels of its inside architecture.
Obecny Dum Praha. Great concert of classic music in Smetana Hall.There is also French Restaurant. You will enjoy of interior.Strongly recommend to be visited.

Gorgeous Art Deco building. We went for a classical music concern when visiting Prague. The tickets are available on the day or the day before. The acoustics were great and so were the musicians. The Hall itself is impressive and the staircases and mirrors. We didn't got on a tour but I imagine it is ornate throughout, a lovely historic building.
Must visit. The vicinity around Municipal House is a buzzing area due to Palladium and Powder Tower being in close proximity. This is a must visit area for any visitor to Prague.
Most beautiful building of Prague. Interiors of this building are really awesome. I will recommend to attend a musical or dance show in the central hall. It's really amazing experience.
Visited for concert! . Nice hall and nice concert I went to! 60 musicians for 90 mins! Loved it. If there is an event do visit!

Prague's City Hall:Treasure House Full of Gems. Prague’s Municipal House is itself a huge gem housing treasures that foreign visitors often overlook.  The building itself, near Republic Square (Namesty Republiki) has beautiful art-nouveau interiors and several levels of galleries, restaurants and exhibition halls. Local residents come here for jazz, classical concerts, art exhibits and even theater. Admission to the building is free, and it is worth it just to ride the great elevator to the top (pretend you have a sprained ankle and they’ll get someone to run the elevator). Then take the stairs down to look at every ornate object along the way. As Trip Advisor itself has noted, “the building was also one of the first in the city to be equipped with central heating and ventilation, a drinking and utility water-supply system, electrical as well as hydraulic elevators, a steam-powered laundry and an intercom network.” If you’re lucky, there may be a jazz band playing to the crowd from the veranda overlooking the square. No hotel concierge told us, but a local wall advertisement announced the art nouveau exhibit at Municipal House. The subway that stops across the street. The exhibit was a delight, featuring everything from painting and paper art to furniture and glass ware, including some oriental influences on art nouveau. The exhibit is open ten a.m. to seven p.m, and the 150 KR ticket (about six dollars) also entitles a 20 per cent discount at the Kavarna Restaurant in the building. The exhibit is open until July 31, 2016. The Municipal House bookstore sells many items from the art nouveau period, some of them reasonably priced, and it also offers a 300-page illustrated catalogue of the Prague Design Museum’s full exhibit (from which the Municipal Hall exhibit is drawn). Guided tours are available with advance booking at 778-543-902 for groups speaking English, French, German or Russian.  If you are in Prague, you owe it to yourself to come here.
Amazing interiors. There are loads of different restaurants and bars in this building and they all have spectacular decoration.

Very beautiful building. One of the more beautiful art nouveau buildings in Prague. Spend some time viewing the fantastic exterior, then walk inside. You can have free access to the lobby and the basement leading to a beautiful old bar. The interior is wonderfully decorated in art nouveau trimmings throughout. Worth the trip to see it and conveniently located near Na Prikope.

Nice landmark. Attended a recital here in the Municipal House. Sat in the Smetana Hall. The performance was good but acoustics a bit lacking. Much better sound in the Hall of Mirrors recital at the Klementinum. Internal architecture was nice. Terrible security guard who refused to let us use the toilets even though we attended the recital!

A unique building.. Don't be confused by the name of the building. It is not a town hall or city hall; it is a centre for the community arts and cultural experiences. If you have any interest in history, architecture or Art Nouveau, take a tour. This is the building where the independence of Czechoslovakia was declared and features paintings by Alphonse Mucha.

Well worth a visit. Lovely building and atmosphere had morning coffee here to start then came back for lunch. The sandwiches where lovely sat outside. Would defiantly visit again as would like to try the hot food

What a magical evening !. It was truly special to hear a concert in the hall my last night there. The music was delightful, the cost was affordable ($20 US) and the hall is magnificent. Hearing the classics played was the highlight of my evening. I would certainly recommend it if you can budget your time. Prague has so much music, I can see where it comes from. They played with such heart.

Stunning. The building boasts a magnificent exterior, proudly grabbing the attention away from the other local buildings. Inside is, similarly, a proud and self aware environment; it is beautiful and it knows it, a wonderfully pristine Art Deco decoration covers/ makes up the inside. A gem.

Lovely place to take in a concert. My hotel was able to get me a ticket to see the Prague Music Chamber Orchestra ("The best of Mozart and Dvorak") at the Municipal House's Smetana Hall...in the center, 4th row! I don't remember exactly what I paid, but it was less than $60.The performance was lovely, around 90 minutes I think, and the setting was traditional and elegant. Smetana Hall and the Municipal House itself was a pleasure to visit. There is a restaurant in the front, but I didn't have a chance to dine there. Next time...
Nice Place. This is a nice place, is beautifully lit in the night. It is close to the Palladium Mall and other Old Town attractions.
Gorgeous Building. We met our walking tour guide there, and were so impressed with the building. It is beautiful place, home to concerts and one of the more photographed places in the city.

"The Best of the Classics". This is a restored hall which displays decorations, painting and sculptures “loaded with symbolism”. The sound quality is very good and the ceiling is a beautifully restored gem. The show was “The Best of Classics” including works by Strauss, Vivaldi, Bach, Mozart, Dvorak and Brahms – performed very well and was delightful experience overall.

Beautiful building, expensive visit. The beautiful is a marvelous art nouveau building, but to visit inside can cost expensively; I don't think it is so interesting if you consider whole attractions in Prague. The best appreciation of this building is outside.

The best site in Prague. Art nouveau heaven. . This is a performance and event venue, not a government office building. Take the guided tour to see all the rooms. Amazingly creative Art Nouveau design.

This was excellent. The venue hosted a Mozart & Strauss 'best of' concert. While the orchestra itself was of good, the Municipal House was of far greater quality: a very grand building with exceptional interior design. I would recommend visiting this while in Prague, but it is not a necessity.

Amazing. Again, I can blame INXS for my obsession with thus building as they had filmed two music videos here for the 'Kick' LP of '87.On Apple maps this is also known as Obecnidum.There was an Art Nouveau exhibition on which we wanted to see. The exhibition was wonderful, but on the same floor, we had a sneak peak into the beautiful auditorium. It is breathtaking,y beautiful. I could have looked at it all day. Next time, I'm booking an evening show here!

More experiences at one point. Obecni dum "Municipal house" is a beautiful building built in the Art Nouveau style, located right in the heart of the city, near to Wenceslas and Old Town squares...This place you can enjoy from different positions - the first - to listen to a concerts in the beautiful concert hall, to visit the exibitions, the second - to buy the ticket and to see all the available representative halls, and the third - to enjoy the quality of the original menu at the restaurant on the ground floor...Public architectural competition was launched in 1903 and with respect to certain circumstances (that has not been chosen winner) municipality development of plans entrusted to the architects A. Balsanek and O. Polivka.The idea of the authors of "Obecni dum" - based on the recommendation of City Hall - was to build up this building as a multi-object associating representation, exhibition, concert, restaurant and retail space.The visit of "Obecni dum" you can join with short / long walk via the center of Prague and you'll be happy to include this nice place to your plan of visit.

Gorgeous building, beautiful acoustics. This hall is absolutely gorgeous. The interior and exterior are very detailed and the acoustics inside sound wonderful. The concert itself was decently priced and the band was amazing. Definitely recommend as Prague is known for its music theatres and talent.
Excellent!. We attended a night time concert here. Wonderful décor and great acoustics inside. Old American restaurant on lower ground floor
Municipal House, Prague. A beautiful and old historic architect, and it's front view stop you to show herself. Best way to see a city life is walking on your foot.

Magnificent..... This was the highlight of our week. You will never see a better example of art nouveau decoration anywhere else in the world. The rooms are so densely decorated and opulent they are awe inspiring and memorable. The tour is essential as you are given a thorough history lesson which is interesting and lively and you should also pay the very low fee of 55 Czech crowns to take photos. There are three bars/restaurants in the basement which aren't in the tour which you should also visit. The food is actually quite cheap down there. We ate in the bistro cafe on the ground floor which is also cheap and opulent and there's also a wonderful restaurant on the other side of the entrance from the bistro for those who are more wealthy than me which is well worth seeing.

Beautiful building, beautiful music.. I saw the Prague Music Chamber Orchestra here. It's a great atmosphere to see a concert. I would love to see music here every week. Unfortunately, I don't live in Prague. This kind of place is one of the reasons Prague is so great.

the best cakes I at for a long time. The old municipal cityhouse is now an opera (above) and a famous tea-room (below). This wonderfull building is a few hundred meters away from the old town square.
Not only is the building (outside and inside) an extraodinary art-deco building but you can have a drink or eat a Czech speciality for a reasonnable price.
The overall quality is average.

Definitely NOT average!. If you are looking for fine dining in Prague for about the same as a pizza in Wenceslas Square (tourist trap) this is the place to go! We received excellent service and fantastic food. The whole meal was an experience - very proper, very traditional. The cheese selection was superb. It was recommended to me by a gentleman and I have no hesitation in recommending it to others. We only went for lunch and had the set menu but I believe the recitals etc here are excellent. Maybe next time

A perfect Art Nouveau masterpiece. The building contains cafes, a concert hall, exhibition spaces and a superb art shop. The interior is a wonder of Art Nouveau decoration and guided tours are available every afternoon and the main concert hall hosts morning and lunchtime concerts of classical music, often with a full symphony orchestra. We also visited an exhibition of outstanding pieces from the Museum of Decorative Arts in Prague which is currently closed for renovation. Its brilliantly curated and covers all aspects of the Secessionist movement, covering glass, ceramics and metalwork, textiles, fashion, furniture and art. If you have the slightest interest in Art Nouveau, this building and this exhibition are must-sees. The café on the left hand side of the ground floor is also a beautiful place ot have some excellent lunches.

Musical performance. Went to a performance of the 7 string players here. It was lovely and was just long enough for 'non classical music people' but we did expect them to either be on a stage or us be in tiered seating so it was a bit disappointing that we couldn't really see very well at all.

Beautiful Art Deco Building. We visited the Municipal House Hall to see an exhibition about a fashion designer and also to see a concert - Vivaldi, Four Seasons which was incredible. The main hall where the concerts are held is stunning, the Art Deco design is beautiful.

Beautiful building. still servicing as municipal house it is beautiful from outside and inside . The building has been well maintained but not a must visit in Prague you can skip seeing it from inside

Beautiful place. We went there to attend the concert "Best of Mozart & Strauss" by dvorak symphony orchestra prague, the orchestra was great, beautiful music. Unfortunately, that is with ballet and singers which ruined the whole performance, I regret so much to have bought the highest price ticket and saw the face of singers so clearly. There singing is ok, but the face expression, gesture and costumes are on the scary side, I need to close my eyes everytime they come out. The ballet was kind of casual and the costumes, shoes look dirty and not ironed...

Interesting, beautiful place, a bit pricey!. The guide is informative and the building and rooms are quite beautiful. However, the price is a bit high! You could just have a drink at the upstairs art deco cafe, for a lovely experience as well.

Sent back in time. We had coffee and cake in the cafe. It was a wonderful experience, the room was beautiful and served by waiters. They brought the sweet trolly to your table, there was no rush and the staff were a delight. Next time I visit I would like to dine in the restaurant.

The Municipal House Hall is not to be missed!. One of the most dropdead gorgeous buildings I have ever seen! Stunning art nouveau interior. We were fortunate enough to see an incredible art deco exhibit while we were there in December of 2015. Put this at the top of your things to do in Prague -- and perfect for a rainy day!

A super meal followed by a concert. The restaurant within this building was recommended to us. Beautiful Art Deco room, excellent service. Food was very good but on the expensive side but a lovely evening and would go back if I wasin Prague again.

Center for performing arts. At Republic Square when facing Old Town Square through the Powder Tower, I found an extraordinarily ornate Art Nouveau building to the right. The Czech name is Obecní Düm Prahá. In May, there were signs advertising live music performances, including Vivaldi. Nowhere near dressed appropriately for formal concerts—and lacking enough time—I had no intention of attending a performance. I did, however, walk into this architecturally magnificent edifice. In a word, Wow! I was in a palace. The city of Prague has performed a miracle by restoring this astounding structure. To visit the lobby there is no cost, so why not take a few moments to experience Old World opulence?

Unbeliveble place. One of the most fantastic art noveau buildings I have seen! Perfectly placed in the Republic square. All fantastic ornaments both outside and inside. Worth a visit to see it all. And then relax in the french café here :)

Walk in to check the interior design is fun too!. It might be even better to see a show inside, but if you didn't have the chance- walk in to check some decorations on the wall by Mucha, or in the basement. You'll fine the beauty of it too.

Nice atmosphere . I went here with 25 of my colleagues for a dinner during our face to face meeting in Prague. Authentic Czech food and good service and a nice atmosphere in the restaurant. Beautiful decorated hall and live music was played. The beer was good. It is quite noisy because of the number of people so not ideal for a quoted romantic dinner. I would come back

Architecturally beautiful. Touring the place is absolutely mind blowing, stunningly decorated, our guide was great. Location is perfect very central in the area and so close to our hotel and the biggest shopping in Prague. This is a must absolutely beautiful
pretty on the outside. we only stopped to take photo's. There is a good little market in this area that's also worth a look. to reach by public transport Metro Line B, trams 5/26/8/24

Centrally located. You really can't visit Prague without, at some point, passing this gorgeous, old building. Check out the large beer hall in the basement. There is also a nice cafe outside the building. Close to many other attractions, as Prague is a very walkable city.

Beautiful Building. We came across this building around the corner from our hotel. We was interested in the classical concerts they hold in the Hall, and popped in for more info. As soon as we walked through the door, I was blown away. I love Art Nouveau design, and this was an incredible example of Art Nouveau Architecture. The Hall is large, and there are different areas inside, each with it's own personality. We attended an evening of Mozart and Beethoven music, all played I assume by local musicians who were all fantastic and actually bought a tear to my eye, the music was so lovely. All in all a fantastic setting, and I would visit again for another show if we ever visit the city again.We actually visited in December 2014, but I was unable to select that far back.

Cake anyone?. The cafeteria place at Municipal Hall - lovely to see and good cake - The choice is very good and a good pit stop for travellers entering into Stare Mesto. Tea does not come in teabags but infusions. They serve breakfasts and light meals. Service is impeccable

Visit the cocktail bar. There is a cocktail bar in the basement that is superb. It is not advertised but make a point of going. Reasonably priced drinks in great surroundings. Decor is probably 1910-1920.

After a good concert, you can't miss it!. The Municipal House has concerts everyday. After such an experience, nothing like continuing in an art deco mood and go for some food at the Cafe or the Restaurant

Super deserts!. do not miss the excellent cakes and pastries here, I would recommend making a trip only for the deserts to this place if you have a sweet tooth! they have some amazing variety and you're going to be spoilt for choice :)
definitely a highlight from my three days in Prague.
Very beautiful art work. I just walked in. I should have purchased tickets to the concert, but never did. Would recommend doing that on my next trip.

In Art de nouveau built palace, congress centre, concert hall, cultural site. It is a highly interesting palace built for people to meet (for concerts, dancing balls, meetings, conferences, etc. in Art de nouveau style. Besides the main concert hall it has many smaller room each of which is decorated in its individual style. It has 2 restaurants, one cafe, one American bar, one wine bar - again each of them in a different style. It is worthwile to visite such a lovely place.

Art Nouveau delight + fine cafe. Take the guided tour of this beautiful art nouveau building to see Czech pride at its best. Beautifully coordinated to the last detail including furniture, light fixtures, and even the curtains. Affordable lunch in the café (to the left of main entry) provides opportunity to savor the décor. Save room for dessert!
A beautiful building!. We went to the lower level and ate a Czech meal there. It was very good and inexpensive compared to the upstairs main restaurant.

Concert was Fantastic. If you like Art Nouveau, this building is the best example I have seen. Gorgeous and the acoustics for the concert were excellent. There is a museum in the building for Art Nouveau that is worth a trip. It is open daily as a separate tour.
Torts. Great for a snack. We ordered several torts off the desert tray. They were wonderful. Love the opulent interior as well. Good choice!
Municipal house. Situated next to powder tower and malls. what's so unique in prague is to find old great buildings next to renaissance style or the modernized.

Beautiful Art Deco building! . Our tour guide recommended taking a short tour of this stunning building and it was well worth it. The one hour tour is offered in various languages throughout the day at a reasonable cost, just check at the ticket office for the times. It's worth paying a little extra to be able to take pictures during the tour. The Municipal Building was built and designed for entertainment, including a stunning concert hall, where concerts were held almost daily during our visit. Every room was in designed differently with the most exquisite attention to detail. Just the variety of chandeliers in each room of the tour is worth the tour! The outside of the building is interesting, but the treasure is inside! It also has a charming cafe on the ground floor that is open for lunch, dinner and drinks in between, with an outdoor terrace that is great for people watching. This building is right beside the black Powder Tower- easy to find!

Exhibition and guided tour 31st May 2016 (13.00). We visited the Municipal Hall on our last day in Prague. We went round the Art Nouveau exhibition first and then took the guided tour of the halls. The exhibition was good but the guided tour of the halls was superb. The halls were spectacular and very decorative and what made the tour very interesting was our guide. The Czech lady who guided us was so passionate about the history of the halls and the Czech Republuc it made the tour very interesting. I would recoomend this tour to anyone who has an journey to spend when In Prague.

Art Nouveau jewel in Prague. Beautiful on the outside and even more on the inside. You can partly visit for free if you take stairs down and have a look in the pub/restaurant which is there. Otherwise you can enjoy yourself in a cafe, already mentioned restaurant, concert hall/ballroom; visit exhibition or join guided tour.

Art Nouveau Wonder. The Municipal House was one of the great surprises of the trip. Located just steps from our hotel in Old Town, it was completed in 1912, just as Czechoslovakia was about to achieve independence from the Austro-Hungarian empire and is an Art Nouveau marvel that celebrates a nation coming into being. The Frankuszka restaurant on the ground floor has amazing art nouveau lighting and elegant food. Upstairs, there are a series of remarkable ceremonial rooms, each designed and decorated by a prominent Czech artist of the time. Perhaps the most beautiful is the room done by Alphonse Mucha, the great art nouveau master, who painted the ceiling and all of the walls with scenes from Czech history. This building is worth making time for.
Tour of Municipal House. The tour was well worth it also the extra fee for taking photos. The guide was wonderful and detail. A very impressive tour that everyone should join.

Beautiful hall with Superb Acoustics. We attended a touristy concert of Vivaldi's Four Seasons to best appreciate the hall. The music was well played-much better than expected. The hall is beautiful. The entire building is a must see. Check out the exhibit hall. The Art Nouveau objects on display were wonderful. I imagine the exhibits change from time to time.

Gorgeous Art Nouveau Building. This is a fine example of a builing in the art nouveau style. The interior is also worth seeing as it has been as well preseved and maintained as the exterior. A stroll through the cafes, bars, and pubs on the inside is really like taking a stepback in time. Well worth a visit.

Try to go to a concert. Although not as large as some historic concert halls, Municipal House Hall or Smetana Hall has excellent acoustics and the Prague Symphony Orchestra is also out standing. We enjoyed a Prague Spring Concert on our last night in Prague.

Grand and elegant. This is the stuff memories come from. A beautiful wondrous galaxy of light and grandeur. Saw Beethoven Symphony and he was in the house! The sound was resonant and added to the drama.

Wonderful concert. I attended a concert here a couple days ago, given by a 8-member chamber orchestra and a violin soloist in the smaller Smetena Hall. They played some Beethoven, Mozart, and Strauss, al of which were wonderful. Actually, a funny thing happened--there were these two people in the seats I had reserved and they insisted that those were their seats, so I got moved to the front row.I also got a good look at the building's extravagant interior while I was there. Overall, well worth the 20 euros/person.

Tour of building. The hall was built at the turn of the 20th century. It is interesting in large part because it celebrates Czech culture but the decorations and artifacts may be of limited interest and with photos it costs 12-13 Euros. The Smetana Hall would make a good venue to enjoy a concert

A Wonderful Concert in Smetena Hall. We attended a concert by the Prague Chamber Orchestra in Smetena Hall; the hall itself is beautiful with ornate furnishings and great acoustics. The orchestra consisting of 9 strings and a keyboard played works by Vivaldi, Pachelbel, and Liszt. Even if you are not a classical music fan, it is well worth a visit to this beautiful hall.

Municipal House Hall. A must see in Prague. Wonderful old building with gorgeous restaurants inside. The outdoor patios of the restaurants are nice, but you must go inside to check out the terrific ambiance.

Mozart and Dvorak concert. We got a chance to appreciate this beautiful concert hall yesterday. The stain glass sky lights were especially lovely. There were eight pieces and an encore done by an octet of strings that was rich in sound but lacking soul. Seemed like they were racing through the pieces. Wished I had known that there is a formal tour of this building which has been a lot of history.

a must for art nouveau lovers. From the Smetana Hall to the room completely designed by Mucha the Obneci Dum as the Municipal House is called is a wondrous display and a source of immense pride to the citizens of Prague. You have to join a tour to view it however which is included in the entrance price. We had hoped to return for the "American " Bar and downstairs restaurant but these had been privately booked for the evening
Stunning. This building is beautiful every time I passed I stood in awe of it the design is amazing you can eat and drink at very reasonable prices too
Incredibly well preserved. A great art nouveau experience. Quite how it's all remained so pristine in over a hundred years. is amazing. It's worth a visit to the American bar downstairs.

A Must-See for Art Nouveau Fans. As good as Brussels in terms of pure Art Nouveau gems. I can't imagine how this survived the Nazis and the Soviet occupation, but it did. By all means, sign up for the one-hour tour in English.to see the gorgeous upstairs parlors and rooms, some of which feature Mucha murals and all of which display exquisite craftsmanship down to the smallest detail. I deeply regret not paying the extra fee to take photos.

A World Class Gem. No tour of Prague should omit the Municipal House. Incredible art nouveau architecture and design throughout. Several food and beverage venues to explore, all beautiful. Lovely concert hall. Go for a concert and eats and drinks.
Enjoyed Mozart and Dvorak. Great evening of excellent classical music quick fix. Saw the 60 minute show in Smetana Hall at 6 pm before dinner. Fantastic musicians.

Free to walk into. Did not take the tour but stepped in and looked at the art deco architecture. This took maybe 10 minutes. If you are near would be worth it to step inside. We were told the restaurants were good but did not eat there.

MaVlast. The purpose of my visit to Prague was for this concert. It is one of the few places in the world that performs this piece live. Very much worth the trip. Note the seats, they were far less than comfortable.
Beautiful Building. So the restaurants in the building are very pricey and so are the concerts but the building itself is worth a visit. It is a beautiful example of Art Nouveau architecture.
Gorgeous Building. Great tour of this historic building in the center of Prague. Had coffee in the cafe and totally enjoyed it. Must do!
It is a place in Prague not to miss. Be it its restaurants, be it its Smetanova síň, be it its beautiful design, be it its perfect location.

Excellent Food. Recommended by Tour Guide to eat here and we were not disappointed by the selection and quality on the "Delicious 3 course Menu" on the daily Tourist offering. Very lavish and ornate surroundings at bargain priced food by UK standards.

Jugendstil Extravaganza. This is an outstanding example of Art Nouveau in a city replete with buildings done in the style. You must book a tour to see all of it. The guide was very informative and paced the tour well. I would put this sight on the must-see list.
Worth a visit. It has two restaurants and a magnificnet bar and the the concert hall have an interesting programme throguhtout the year.
Watch the waistline. Lovely place to relax and have a Coffee and a gateau. Good value and large portions in a lovely setting

stunning interior and exterior. You can only see the inside of this beautiful building by going to a concert there but tickets are fairly easy to come by and the concerts are fun even for the non serious music type. Really it is worth it just to sit and look around at the decor. Art Nouveau. There is a cafe adjoined to it so you can get a glimpse there and enjoy a coffee.
Art Nouveau Masterpiece. Houses the fabulous Francouzska Restauant...but worth walking in and around this gorgeous edifice. A wonderful "Farmers Market" in the square near-by!

A classic building. The building has a brilliant Art Nouveau façade. Downstairs the is an American style bar and dining room, where you can soak up the elegant features. The tiles are superb and there's even a smart water feature. Look at the chandeliers and light fittings as well as the great mirrors and floor tiles. It was a pity that we weren't able to glimpse inside the main concert hall - elsewhere it's all free, except the drinks!
Beautiful hall!!!. I attended a wedding in the hall which was wonderful. Perfect place for such an occasion. There is also a bar downstairs and a restaurant that you can go and enjoy this venue.

One of my favorites . A beautiful building inside and out. I highly recommend a tour. Beautiful attention to detail. If you have a chance for a concert fix have a coffee afterwards in the baseball Americana Bar or a less expensive meals in the downstairs dining room.

A sublime decorative masterpiece. The Municipal House is representative of a revitalized Prague in the early 1900's. Somewould say it is the most famous Art Nouveau building in Prague. There was a competiton in 1903 for the best design with construction beginning about 1905 and finishing in 1912. Most everyone starts their visit rushing into the interior; however, from the outside of the front of the building take a step back and look up to see the mosaic of a Tribute to Prague and below that the decorative marquise which covers the main entrance. The great works of Mucha are well known in the interior as are those by Zenisek and Novak. When you are in the Mayoral Hall viewing the works of Mucha be sure to ask your guide to identify in the ceiling the different figures in Czech history such as Charles IV, Jan Hus, George Potebrad and others. Really interesting. We walked-up for tickets to the 3:00 English language visit. Guide was well versed and it was a pleasant hour.

Just right. The fact that the concert is only one hour long indicates that it's aimed mostly at tourists, but the musicianship was still amazing! The theater is gorgeous, so for those of us who aren't classical musical aficionados, but who want to enjoy a touch of culture in a gorgeous setting, this concert is perfect.
Gorgeous monument. Exceptionally built and adjacent to the Powder tower, it is surprisingly not a medieval structure but built in the last century.
4 days in Prague. a Must and a Beauty. WAW it is gorgeous, wether from the exterior as well as the interior. At least take the time for a coffee or a beer .
Gorgeous art deco building. Beautiful from the outside and just as impressive on the inside. A guide would have been nice to explain the history and features of the building.

Art Nouveau Splendour - Great Exhibition. Went to see the Art Nouveau exhibition at the Obecni Dum in May 2016. What other location than this stunning building could suit the exhibits better than the Obecni Dum. The whole building is a proverbial total work of art. I was fascinated. If you´re interested in the arts in General and in Art Nouveau in particular this is a place you must not miss. Highly recommended.

The tour of the Municipal House is a must. If you do just one tour in Prague make sure it is of the Municipal House. You can enter for free and get a taste but you have to pay for the tour. Make sure you book at least 24hrs in advance. Cost is 290 kc per adult.Difficult to describe in words the beauty of this building. If you like art nouveau and Alfons Mucha style you will love this. There are also very stylish restsurants in the House and the famous American Bar.... great cocktails here.
Great place to visit. Wonderful place, Cant be missed at all be all visitors In town.Definetely a must see, And if you can get ticket for a concertIt Will be am unforgetable experiente.

Totally amazing. For me, this was the find of Prague! I was not expecting the amazing Art Nouveau decoration everywhere. We wandered around with mouths open and then had delightful cocktails in the American Bar. Absolutely not to be missed.

Fabulous Art Nouveau building. This is a beautiful building from all aspects, the outside has intricate stonework, gold trimmings frescos and stained glass inside is a huge marble staircase leads to a magnificent concert hall. Be sure to take tea & cake in the restaurant inside and admire the stunning Art Nouveau architecture with gold & crystal chandeliers that hang majestically from high ceilings. Well worth a visit.

Municipal House Tour. Well worth joining a 1 hour tour of the Art Nouveau rooms on the first floor, especially if not able to attend a concert . Smetana Hall and the smaller rooms around the perimeter simply amazing decoration and chandeliers. Tour size limited to 35 and in April only 3 tours per day. Adult cost 290 CZK. Tour guide excellent English.
Great music hall. I like this building too much. Architecture, street, boulevard and old style lights. All was perfect. If you have time in Prague you must listen a classic concert in this building.
Art nouveau!. beautiful building designed by Alphonse Mucha. Currently hosts a small but very nice exhibition on european secessionism.

Quite spectacular on the outside and inside!. If you have time to explore, then the Municipal House Hall is a must visit in Prague. It is quite spectacular! .. Take your time to admire its beautiful Art Nouveau architecture style - on the outside and inside!
Amazing. If you love art nouveau this place is a must! Fabulous. The café and restaurant are so atmospheric and the food is great.

Amazing Art Nouveau and a bit of Deco restored interiors. The tour here was fantastic. There are so many ha;;s and salons, each one different and beautiful. The guide spoke excellent English and was full of information. It was a great experience, not least for the Murcha paintings and decorations

Interesting Architecture. This is a site to view from the outside only. Interesting architecture and a very large edifice. Make sure to climb the Powder Tower next door which is attached to the Municipal House Hall. Great views of Prague from the top.

Art Nouveau Exhibition. Small exhibition over two rooms. Well displayed and English text.Lovely old building with original lift, if stairs too difficult. Great little museum gift shop was an added bonus, selling quality Czech gifts.
Attended concert comma and had a few drinks.. Attended to very nice classical concert , Mozart and Dvorak...excellent! Then had post-concert beverages in the oldest bar in Prague!

Fantastic acoustics . I have been there for a classical music concert in Smetana hall. Building itself is very impressive, and hall is really something. You can hear very tiny tones from each instrument.
Must see if you have time in Prague.

A nice place. We have been to the Municipal House on many occasions.The Architecture is stunning and the Chandeliers in the upstairs restaurants Wow! We have not been to a concert there but this is on our Bucket list.On the lower floor is a traditional Czech Beer Hall with good food and Pilsner Beer.My friend has a tiling business and he is always amazed at the tiled Murals on the walls.A must visit when in Prague.

Take the Tour. While it is a beautiful building, it holds a lot of Czech history. The tour really gives a nice overview of important Czech figures and insight into how the Czech people view themselves. And all of that is captured in one way or another in this building. And keep the tour ticket as you can get 2 for 1 drinks at the American bar downstairs.

Go and see a concert!. We have visited the municipal house hall for a Mozart concert. The acoustic was perfect, the art-nouveau hall reminds other era. I think someone must visit when in Prague especially in an event with the National Prague Orchestra.

Look at the decor but avoid the French Restaurant !. WE attended a concert in the building ( was fine ), visited exhibition ( limited) and ate in the "live piano French Restaurant". The scallops on green pea base was reasonable, the pheasant was tasteless, the steak arrived on a cold plate, the potato was cold.  We were on Notice.....In A Cadogan Guide from 1994 it said , "all meals served with a snarl.... one day a meal here might be as pleasurable as the Art Nouveau interior "The snarl had gone but the food was really poor and the service non existent. We had six servers , no one knew who had ordered what and when we asked why no-one had asked us whether we had enjoyed the meal ( perhaps someone sensed we were not over the moon ), that question was met with a shrug.The wine was expensive and the food very poor value.Give this restaurant a wide berth.We will not be returning.Hopefully some day the food and service will match the decor.

Stunning building. If you like art nouveau you will love this building, its quite beautiful! Interior is just fantastic, be sure to check out the american bar...also, there is a great shop downstairs, didnt see it on my first trip. The prices on great Czech crystal is about 30 percent less than in old town square, bought a nice Vocotek lamp in Moser, only to find it 1/3 less there..ohh well..live and learn!
So lovely cafe!. It's like you tranfer to another era the moment you step in this lovely cafe.They also serve delicious cakes (try the honey cake)! We went there 3 times in 4 days!

Loved the exhibitions, the tour and the Cakes at the Cafe!!!. A true depiction of art deco. I strongly recommend the guided tour. We also enjoyed a classical music concert with an orchestra but it was not the symphonic orchestra. The museum has many art and other objects from the 1912 era and is well worth it. The concer hall provided great acoustic and was truly enjoyable given all the lush decorations and the magnitude. The cafe on the left side (when facin front) offeres awesome cakes and desserts, its a must. But go early as the cake variety quickly disappears. On some saturdays there is live music!

Beautiful inside & out.. We decided at the last minute to attend the Vivaldi Four Seasons concert here one afternoon and were very pleased. The interior was beautiful and the music outstanding! It was a good place to relax and refresh at the end of a long day walking.

Beautiful. This building is beautiful. I walked past it everyday during my trip and never got tired of looking at the facade. We did not eat in the cafe or restaurant, but the decorations were amazing.
Fabulous building. Excellent Art Nouveau building. We had the most delicious coffee and cake. Several years ago attended a musical evening here but missed out this trip.

Not as Advertised!!!!. I visited the municipal hall on the 22/03/16 for the 17:30 performance for the Classical concert. Gutted I was not in the main auditorium for this, as were many of the other people who were attending this performance due to the misleading advertising. So please check upon booking where your concert will be heald within the building. Luckily the performance was amazing to counteract this disappointment.

Impressive Art Deco building.
