Municipal House is a multi purpose civic building in central Prague located in Náměstí Republik next to the Power Gate.Famous for its Art nouveau style, it houses Smetana Hall, a celebrated concert venue hosting classical concerts, opera & ballet plus events including fashion shows. It it well with a visit for those who love architecture and classical music.

Very impressive Jugendstil complex. Large stylish multipurpose buidling with restaurants, exhibition rooms and concerthall. Stunning Jugendstil interior and exterior. Buy a ticket for a concert and you'll not be dissapointed. Great orchestra in an even greater decor. A must see for music and culture lovers.

Lovely architecture and cool things to learn. This is the place if you love architecture and style of secession and Art Deco. Style of Alfons Mucha, his font everywhere, the acoustic, everything was really educational. The guide was extra kind and willing to answer all questions. Worth to visit also the American Bar which is in underground and it's first bar where women were allowed without accompanying by men.

Art Deco. My wife and I were on vacation and staying in Praha. The basement restaurant was delicious. The staff were very nice and theirservice was professional. Definitely recommend it for tourists and locals.

Good food, good entertainment here!. There is a restaurant in the hall that sells the best soup at a very reasonable price. When you book events, know that the hall offers large and small venues within the building. We booked what turned out to be a chamber music concert, and had thought we were getting a full philharmonic orchestra. We ended up in an area that only seated maybe 150 people.

Municipal House Hall. We initially entered this beautiful building to visit the magnificent permenant Art Nouveau exhibition on the second floor, but were astounded by what else the building contained. Not only are there two restaurants on the ground floor and a grand concert hall on the second, but fell in love with the Americky Bar in the basement which also has a large beautiful restaurant and function room, we spent several evenings in the Art Nouveau bar which was not at all expensive.
Beautiful . Located near Palladium shopping centre, again lovely architecture and just a stroll around this area is well worth it.

Must-see for any Mucha fan or art fan. As soon as I found out that one of the rooms at the Municipal House had been decorated by Alphonse Mucha I knew I had to visit! The guided tour, which took about an hour, of the upper floor of the Municipal House did not disappoint. The Mayor Hall was breathtaking, not only did Mucha paint a ceiling fresco as well as three wall frescos, he also designed the window panes and the furniture as well as a beautiful curtain for one of the doors. The tour guide was also very knowledgable about the building and the different artists that created artworks for the various rooms. Initially, the Municipal House was built as a centre for Czech culture and as a place for social gatherings. At the time there was a German casino and the German House, so, the Czech people felt they needed a space of their own to celebrate their culture and history. Today, the Municipal House, is still used for concerts at the famous Smetana Hall and other halls but also for balls and as a civic building. This building is worth a visit as the ground floor and the lower floor can be visited free of charge whereas you need to take a guided tour of the upper floor. And if you want to take pictures during the tour you'll need to buy a photo pass. Check the box office to get the schedule for the tours. The tours are given in Czech or English but there are also written explanations in various other languages like German, French, Italian, Spanish, Japanese and Russian.
Magical!. beautiful Art Nouveau building and cafe with lots of history and a good location near the majestic Powder Towers
Art Nouveau at its best. This building which was once the royal palace is a joy to the art nouveau school. Every part of the building is perfect. You need to see this.

Beautiful building with nice concerts. I went here to a Lord of the Rings concert by an orchestra. The architecture of the building is beautiful. There also are a lot of good concerts being held at this building.
Breath taking. This is a breath taking Building,really a piece of treasure.We just stumbled upon it.Well worth seeing,probably just as amazing inside aswell

A rather nice building in the Old Town of Prague. The Municipal House sat right next to the Powder Tower in the Old Town of Prague. I just dropped by and took a look inside, noting that it has a Concert Hall (Smetana Concert Hall - home base of the National Symphony Orchestra), a couple of restaurants and bar and some exhibition rooms. Guided tour of the building was available for tourists. Since I did not use any of the facilities, I did not know about the interiors but I was impressed by its exterior architectural style and it is worth a re-visit to attend a classical concert and perhaps try its French restaurant. Although it is a rather young building compare with its neighbor, the Powder Tower, I learnt that it does have some historical significance as the proclamation of the independent State of Czech appears to have taken place here.

Beautiful architecture. This has to be my favourite building in Prague. Built in the early 20th century, for me, as a Czech patriot, it is a sign of Czech "golden hands". The interiors are amazing, each room decorated by someone else (Mucha´s room is stunning). One of the advantages is the lack of tourists in the general tour. While I was waiting for the guided tour, many people bought tickets for evening´s concerts but barely anybody for the tour inside. I can only recommend it, as even with only about 5 rooms, there is a lot to see and a lot beauty to take in. The tour lasts for about an hour, and are in Czech, English and probably also other languages if requested.You can then visit also other parts of the hall, just to "take a look", and notice little architectonic details.
Good . It's one of the best building in Prague and interior is stunning with a coffee shop and bar inside this building and price here is an average.

Extraordinarily decorated . Looks like an Opera house but it's actually a Municipal house. There are guided tours for 290czk that last about an hour and classical music concerts starting from 730czk. Inside, there are a couple of restaurants, cafés and a bar.

FINE CLASSICAL EVENING.. Attend at the Smetana Hall. Classical Concert. By FOK. Prague Symphony Orchestra. Music by E Rautavaara, Tchaikovsky, & Shostakovich. Memorable Evening. Person in Audience is Taken Ill. Concert Suspended for a Time. Continues. Very Good Performance by a Excellent Orchestra.

Well worth a visit.... The Municipal Hall is quite overwhelming at first view outside, but within there are multiple things to see/do. There's a restaurant on one side of the entrance hall and a cafe at the other side. An Art Deco bar downstairs, varying exhibitions upstairs. We took the guided tour around the Hall, a fascinating mixture of different styles of architecture and decoration in each room....my favourite being the Mucha room. It was place we entered by accident but would recommend to other tourists. English speaking tour took about an hour, you can leave outerwear and bags at the cloakroom, pay a charge on collection. There are information sheets in most languages if you happen upon a non English tour, or check times for the language you want.

Vivaldi Four Seasons Concert. We booked to see Vivaldi four seasons on a Friday at 6pm. The tickets cost around £16 pounds per person and we weren't disappointed. I would say we are not massive followers of composers but found this extremely enjoyable. The concert lasted around an hour. We did expected it to be held in grand room but were in a small hall. The chairs are rather uncomfortable, even to sit for a short period of time. These are the only criticisms and we would definitely visit again.
A beautiful building. A beautiful building that is in the Art Nouveau style. It has a concert hall and two restaurants of which they have a silver service and a reasonably priced tourist menu

My favourite Prague building. This place is just amazing. Gawp at it from the outside; see all the details high up and then go inside for a coffee and delicious cake [served off a trolley s in days gone by]. If you can, go to a concert in the hall too and appreciate what a wonderful place it is.

Lunch in nice setting . The Municipal House is such a grand building. Having a spot of lunch here always seems very special. Watching the world go by as you eat was quite relaxing. It is a 'must visit' place when Prague.

Beautiful Art Deco building. A wonderful place to visit, particularly if you appreciate Art Deco architecture and interior decoration. There are many different examples of this era throughout the building.
Beautiful concert hall, restaurant and cafe. Sit indoors to enjoy the beautiful building and enjoy a coffee and devious cake at a very reasonable price. The architecture is fantastic! A must see!

Evening concert was delightful, morning tour as well.. We loved the music evening and the next day we joined the guided tour of the whole building. I recommend both very highly. It's a great example of the art deco era and te guide was excellent. Great idea to offer a half price drink at the end! Pity we were not able to get a table at the restaurant as I believe it's very good.

Music in the municipal building. Listened to Mozart and Dvorak played by Prague music orchestra in the municipal building, very enjoyable despite concert tickets being very pricey for what turned out to be 8 people playing. The Smetna hall was very ornate and an exquisite venue

A must for Art Nouveau fans. What an amazing civic building! I want to go back and see more: it's just perfect, inside and out. We particularly enjoyed the chance of a mid-morning coffee break in the superbly stylish cafe (or there's a separate, and equally beautiful restaurant for main meals). If you fancy a classical concert immersed in art nouveau surroundings, go for tickets for the impressive concert hall.

Rich sumptuous building. Very beautiful building with a rich important history for the Czech Republic and Prague. We did the guided tour of +/- an hour in which you see the music hall and some rich decorated rooms containing paintings of elegant grandeur.
A classic. The Municipal gets you to a confort place, good food, beautiful view of the archtecture classic and good prices.

It is worth the visit. Beautiful, interesting art nuveau building.Classic music concerts are performed in the auditorium. You can visit this place just to admire the magnificent architecture that takes you to the golden years of the city A very elegant restaurant on the first floor an a traditional restaurant in the basement. We tried the one in the basement. Would not return, mainly for turists.

A must see. Both the exterior and interior of this building are outstanding examples of Art Nouveau at it's finest. There is a formal tour, which I did not take, but just wandering the public areas is worth a visit. Frequent concerts take place in the lower level, as well as the large hall. Several dining establishments are housed in the building, including the historic American Bar and a beautiful upscale restaurant.
Art Deco at its best. Wonderful restaurant with wonderful food in Art Deco surroundings and very attentive staff.Very old building decorated exquisitely.

Limited. We were unable to see as much as we would have liked. However the tiles and decorative work on the stairs are stunning and the cocktails in the American Bar were delicoous and gave us a chance to look at the wonderful interior.

A Must. Wow! What an amazing building. We took a guided tour ( the only way to see the place) which was very educational. The architecture and the internal design with the decorated halls and rooms were pretty amazing.

Great concert. We went to listen to a short concert of popular classic including a little bit of opera and ballet. A great way to spend an evening!The hall was spectacular and the music was very entertaining!

Art Nouveau heaven. Beautiful building covered in Art Nouveau details. Loved the exterior and interiors so much. The exhibition of European Art Nouveau which is on until July 2016 is in two upstairs rooms and the items were beautiful to see, under £5 entry. You can pay more to tour the whole building.

Beautiful!. This beautiful, historic concert hall is a must see for music and history lovers! Depending on the time of year, if you're lucky to catch a concert here with the Prague Symphony Orchestra, you won't regret it! The decor is absolutely breathtaking and the orchestra is top notch!
Stunning - beautfully preserved Art Nouveau Building - in & out!. Exquisite example of the Art Nouveau movement - A MUST-SEE experience. The current exhibition has a wonderful array of items to view.

Enjoyable architectural tour. We enjoyed the informative tour of this Art Nouveau architectural building. We went through the different rooms that are well preserved and the tour guide did a good job describing each room in great detail.

Only saw it from the outside.... ... and it was already impressing. I couldn't stop staring at it and I wished we went inside. At first I thought it was the opera house though, so I didn't bother having a closer look.
historic building!. this building combines restaurant,coffee and culture.there are event some days every week and the atmospere is unique.
Art Deco delight. Fabulous building inside and out. Get at table in the cafe, try the hot chocolate, one of the fabulous cakes and just people watch.

Brilliant. Absolutely amazing building! Brilliant architecture and looks beautiful at night. The inside is designed magnificently. We watched an orchestra play there, was lovely. Not overly expensive. Would recommend.

Art Nouveau Gesamtwerk. Impressive and meticulously art nouveau building, every where you look there is an example of taste and craft. Dont confuse the very upscale Francouseka restaurant with the more rustic Bierkeller atmosphere ( but also art Nouveau) of THE Plzner restaurant in the cellar, and there is also THE Café

Suprising. At the bottom of the house there was a big pub/restaurant serving lunch, traditional checkish food and beer. Good prices. It was a disappointment that we could not see the house otherwise without buying a ticket.

Classic Art Nouveau architecture. Municipal House is a prime example of Art Nouveau building in Prague. It houses several restaurants and a café, and a great concert hall. Built in 1911 , Municipal House played a critical role on the 28th October 1918's proclamation of the independent state of Czechoslovakia.

Stunning. A magnificent example of Art Nouveau architecture on a grand scale, wonderfully preserved. We only visited the public areas (not the main auditorium), but the decoration is wondrous to behold. It really takes one back to a period of wonderful elegance. The famous graphic artist Alphonse Mucha made a major contribution to the decoration here
Fabulous building. We went to see an art exhibition, so climbed up the stairs to the 2nd Floor. Very grand, almost off a film set. Stunning to look around, interesting shop, and FABULOUS coffee shop.

Beautiful place to visit for an afternoon. Myself and my partner visited the lovely Municipal House for coffee and cakes. The cakes are gorgeous and handmade and served fresh to you when you want. Ridiculously well priced - only 100 czk for a large piece of handmade and fresh cake ! The staff were attentive and polite. Would recommend this place to anyone interested in art deco and architecture :)

Magnificent!. When trying to book a concert my husband and I were amazed that on that Sunday there were 40 classical music concerts just in the city of Prague. Not knowing the city very well we just chose the theater closer to our hotel. It happened to be the Municipal House. What a beautiful place! He went in the morning to pick up our tickets but when we got there that night the view was simply spectacular. It's like a fairytale Princess castle.Inside it's also very baroque and the quality of the musicians performing that night, impeccable.Vivaldi would have been touched by those four seasons !

Absolutely beautiful . This stunning Art Nouveau building is a delight and worth a visit even if you aren't into interior design! U feel like u should dress up just to walk in the door!We had breakfast in the cafe which was full of sparkling chandeliers.Breakfast was generous and tasty - especially the Apple strudel. The coffee wasn't that good - standard filter stuff.Definitely worth several trips - bars / cafes and restaurants.
Well worth a visit. Our first visit to Prague and was determined to visit and have coffee tea & cakes with my wife here..we were not disappointed

Art Nouveau at its best. We had dinner in the cafe of the Municipal Hall. The waiters were friendly and efficient and our meal of lamb casserole and spinach croquettes was very tasty. Prices in the cafe are much less than those in the restaurant. The cafe has wonderful lights and is decorated with lots of mirrors in the art nouveau style. It was pleasant listening to the sound of the small waterfall while having dinner. After dinner we went to a concert in the Smetana Hall up the broad staircase in the Municipal Hall. The hall is a wonderful example of Art Nouveau with sculptures on the corners and decorations on the domed ceiling and an amazing organ. The gold decorations shone in the low light. The eight piece chamber orchestra played works from Mozart, Brahms, Dvorak and others. The concert lasted about an hour. It was a wonderful concert in a breathtaking hall.
Beautiful . . .. Not a destination, but if one is in the area do stop by to admire the beautiful building with a period elevator and interesting mosaics.

Excellent Concert, superb food.. We visited the cafe for a coffee and a piece of honey cake. Both really nice. Whilst we were there we checked out the Restaurant next door and the concert venue upstairs. It looked good so we booked both for later in the day. January appears to be a quiet time in Prague and particularly Sunday. The concert was really enjoyable. A chamber Orchestra with 8 musicians played a variety of classical favourites and the acoustics were brilliant. The whole building is a stunning piece of Architecture and atmosphere. The Restaurant before the concert was very quiet we were one of three groups eating at 6.00 p.m. The service was very attentive, the food was outstanding but be prepared for a bill to match. Earlier in the day they do a set menu which looks within the price range of most people. Overall very enjoyable unique experience.

Definitely a must see for Art Nouveau and Art Deco lovers!!. We happened upon the Municipal Hall by chance, as in my opinion it is not recommended highly enough. It is definitely worth taking the tour, which you have to pay for and which takes approximately an hour. The interiors are stunning and a great example of the early 1900's Art Nouveau and Art Deco styles.

Must see. Beautiful art nouveau building; outside is good but inside is stunning. Bought tickets for a 6pm chamber orchestra concert and came back in the evening for it. Excellent musical experience. One hour of Vivaldi's Four Seasons and other light classical pieces. Thoroughly enjoyed the concert and followed it up with a meal in the downstairs restaurant where an accordionist was playing popular tunes. The shop on the premises is worth a visit for the art on view.

The heart of Prague City!. The Municipal House Hall is a massive old building right in front of the Divaldo Hibernia, a theater. It is also located just jn front of the entrace to the Namesti Republiky metro station, next to King's Court Hotel and across the Palladium. There are tours inside the musem but for a fee.

Unexpectedly interesting. Went to see an Art Nouveau exhibition. The interior of the hall is stunning. Old world elegance. Beautiful Art Deco cafe with more reasonable prices than the everyday establishments elsewhere in the old town. Well worth a visit.

beautiful surroundings. Had hot chocolate and beer inside the building. Good service in art deco surroundings. go downstairs and there is a traditional folk restaurant. Lovely surrounding. Go upstairs for more ornate surrounding beautiful deco..

A Must See Building and Concert in the Czech Capital, Prague. A Must See Building and Concert in the Czech Capital, Prague.We visit the cafe with Art Deco style, that was very poor and disappointing one ! but the Smetana Hall where concerts take place was really an unforgettable experience ! Must See to believe !
Enjoyed this!. This was interesting and we enjoyed reading all the captions of the pictures that lined the wall as you climbed inclined walk to the top

Municipal Hall. This hall is beautiful. We saw a concert here however it was held in one of the smaller room. We were disappointed. So if you buy tickets to see a concert here ask where it is held in the building
Another interesting building. Another interesting building on Namesti Republiky Square. Good architecture, nice fit into around buildings.

Art Nouveau at its best. You can take a tour (in English or other languages) but need to sign up (and pay) near the entrance. Be prepared to do this several hours in advance and come back. There are several restaurants including the American Bar in the basement, a more formal dining room and a wonderful bistro which doesn't require reservations. All are art nouveau par excellence. The bistro restaurant (at street level) serves local food at very reasonable prices. The tour allows you to see the Smetana Hall (for concerts) as well as many private rooms. A true gem of design in many, many details. Take your time seeing this amazing building.

Decor Masterpiece. We were able to attend a concert in Smetana Hall and a string ensemble played a selection of the great classical pieces, including 'the largo from the New World by Dvorak. At 730Kc for seats towards the back of the hall, I didn't feel it was cheap, unless you have a sense of musical history and/or enjoy the classics. The Obecni Dum and Smetana hall are superb decor and architectural masterpieces, and the cafe on the ground floor is itself worth a detour for the same reasons--and not too expensive!

Beautiful Theatre with the best Cafe in Prague!. The Smetana Theatre in the Municipal House is a wonderful hall to hear live classical music - you can also go on tours of the building. The cafe at the entrance is our favorite place in Prague! Great street position and marvellous art nouveau construction and decorations. We had breakfast/morning/afternoon coffee there every day and enjoyed the coffee, beer, cake, ambiance and environment. Would recommend a visit!

Beautiful, Gilded, Stunning. Although I didn't go in this building, I understand it hosts concerts. I was utterly impressive by its beautiful design and structure and its guilded accents. I would certainly go in if I could be there again and so should you!

Amazing night. We went to a concert at the Municipal House and the performance was excellent. The Czech Philharmonic played beautifully and it as truly a wonderful night. The inside of the Municipal House is beautiful and the Smentana hall elegant. The stained glass roof above the hall is stunning and unique.

A really enjoyable tour. An enthusiastic, knowledgeable guide brought this magnificent building to life. Loved the various rooms with their different styles. The sound from the center of the round room was amazing. It is great to have a the building still in use today for concerts and meetings rather than just being a museum. Enjoyed a lovely meal in the basement after our tour.

Perfect concert place. If you can book yourself a place here for a concert, it is magnificent ! If you can't make it just go there for a breakfast let's say. This building been through things in the history and you should see it and absorb it as well ;)

Beautiful interior!. Went on a Sunday night to listen to the Prague Chamber Orchestra perform Vivald's Four Seasons - beautiful building - so impressive! The smetana hall is simply stunning! If you can...be sure to attend a concert here. Very impressive!
Really good tour. We very much enjoyed the tour of Obecni Dum. The rooms are beautiful, the guide was really interesting and friendly. The extra exhibitions were interesting too.

Art Nouveau at its best. this is a fantastic example of Art Nouveau Architecture and interior design. The ceramic tiling to the stairs and the basement Dining hall is superb. the Murals having been created by Mucha. The beautifully preserved light fittings and Ironmongery through out the building need to be seen to be believe. A must to visit for anyone interested in Architecture, interior design orhistory of design.

Great Tour.. Interesting for art nouveau. Tours are in English but written commentary is delivered in their language to tourists who do not speak English. There is a charge to take pictures so that the visit is quite expensive.

Wonderful concert, fabulous architecture. We bought tickets to listen to a string ensemble play Mozart and Vivaldi from a box in the upper deck. The seats we had were general admission but the upper boxes were so hard to find, very few people were seated up there. The sound was fabulous, the view from the box was fantastic, and it was a really nice evening. The tickets were about 40 US and we felt like it was well worth the expense. Hearing Mozart in Vienna was priceless.

Beautiful, but skippable inside. We visited here at the end of a long day of walking around and seeing Art Nouveau Prague. The building is beautiful outside. Inside, which is free, continues the same beauty. We walked around inside, I was tired and I didn't see anything worth the effort at the end of a long day.

Gem of a building best seen from the inside. We went to this building to attend a live music performance in the small hall, and although seating was very basic, we were not expecting to find the wealth of interesting architectural features, stained glass windows and Prague history which we found at every step. What a gem of a building, well suited to its use today as a multi-functioning and civic area. There is a traditional Czech restaurant downstairs. There is a central lift, but this was not working on our visit. The ladies toilets are upstairs, and the men's downstairs. Difficult to access if mobility is a problem, and lift not working. Probably not suitable for children, buggies or the infirm. The building is free to enter although the concert we attended was a ticket only event. Ticket office is a small booth just inside the main doors to the right.
Waw!. Elegantly build and well preserved, Contemplate it from the inside and enjoy it even more. Entrance is free.

Wonderful concert with a taste of ballet, polkas and opera. Most nights there are concerts available. We bought tickets on the day at the Municipal House box office, which were reduced from 700 czk, (about 30 euro) down to 500 czk on 6th January 2016 and attended a concert in one of the Municipal Concery halls. The building is art deco and the hall had the most amazing paintings on the ceiling, of mystical figures riding horses. The 12-member chamber orchestra played Mozart Arias, Dvorak dances and Strauss polkas.There were also 4 ballet dancers and an opera singer for the arias. Lovely night and dinner is available at 3 restaurants in the building. The basement, and two street level restaurants with interesting chadeliers. We ate at the street level brasserie where a 3 course tourist menu costs 290 czk. The soup was watery, but the mains of eorher goulash, roast beef or schnitzel were good. The cake trolley looked amazing but we stuck with fruit salad included on tourist menu. Check the conerts each night, the 7 th and 14th January is Vivaldi, 18 24 30th January is a concery with a selection of Brahams, Mozart, Dvorak. The musicians all play for premier orchestras such as Czech Radio. well worth a visit.

Inconsistent policies. Cloak room custom, policy, non-policy? We attended several concerts at the Municipal House in Smetana Hall. Only for one were we required to check our coats in the cloak room. Although we had purchased prime seating, the ushers insisted we check our coats and would not let us take our seats until we did. Because their seats are uncomfortably hard I prefer to fold up my compact very lightweight down coat and use it as a cushion. For this one concert I was not allowed to do that. "It is just policy" I was told. Yet it was only for that concert and not for the other two we heard in the hall the same week...

See a concert. Listened to Vivaldi's Four Seasons between Christmas and New Year's in the Smetana Room. Stunning experience, exceptional first violinist, impressive venue and very reasonable price of 50Can$ for box seats.

Incredible Art Nouveau architecture. If you love architecture then you need to see the Obecni Dum. The exterior is incredible. I went into the cafe inside for a cup of coffee which was a nice break as well. The Powder Tower is also right across the street and provides a nice view of Prague.

Wonderful Tour. We took the tour of the Municipal House and truly enjoyed it. First of all it's a beautiful building and as others have said a great example of Art Nouveau. But the best part for me was the guide and his obvious love for his job and the building itself. The hour flew by before we knew it. I highly recommend taking the tour.

Wow!. Listened to the Prague Symphony Orchestra play Dvorak's Slavonic dances on New Years Day. An amazing venue, fantastic orchestra, excellent experience. Would recommend people to get there early and enjoy a glass of fizz (50czk) and purchase a programme - we didn't and regret it!
Art Nouveau Masterpiece!. Do not miss this glorious building! It houses a concert hall and a theatre and there is an exhibition space as well. Breath taking architecture and interior design details.
Art Nouveau Gem. Superb and richly decorative..Stunning lighting and the stained glass is unique. Be sure to go on the 1 hour tour..well worth it!

Beautiful inside and out.. This is just another stunningly beautiful building found in Prague. It is 100% worth the tour and even if you walk past and snap the outside, you'll once again mutter 'wow' under your breath as this beauty just sits there amongst hundreds of others of it's like.
Take the tour!. You must take a tour to see this building. It's an art nouveau masterpiece and well worth the hours time. The cafe on the ground floor is famous but nothing special.

Plzenska Beer Hall Restaurant (in basement of The Municipal House Hall). Many may have heard of this beautiful Art Nouveau building near the famed 'Powder Gate' in downtown Prague, site of a celebrated concert venue (Smetana Hall), and a few may even be aware of the elegant French restaurant also located at the site. However, the true 'gem' of the beautiful Municipal House Hall is located in the basement. I refer to the Plzenska Beer Hall Restaurant (often called the 'Pilsen Restaurant'), which is a large, old fashioned beer hall restaurant in the classic fin de siecle Czech style. This traditional Czech gathering spot will remind some of the commodious Bavarian beer halls, but that's where the similarity largely ends. Built in 1905 on the site of the Royal Czech Residence, the Municipal House Hall is a virtual showplace of European Art Nouveau ('Jugendstille') of the early 1900s and features a substantial bill of fare consisting of traditional Czech style food and drinks. It also features, needless to relate, several excellent beers and wines, chief among them all being the famed Pilsner Urquell...a brew of world class fame.Featuring a range of large beer-hall style tables, but also providing a few more intimate tables for couples & smaller groups, it is perfect for everyone who is interested in capturing a bit of what Prague must have been like at the start of the 20th Century (at the height of the Austro-Hungarian Habsburg dynasty, just before the 'Great War').If you are lucky and visit in the evening hours, you will be greatly entertained by the 'Duo Svejk' ('Duo Schweik', as it translates to in German), which is comprised of a very talented musician duo (accordion and bass fiddle) who play & sing traditional Czech period songs, dressed in the Austro-Hungarian Army style of Czech Writer Jaroslav Hasek's beloved character, the 'Good Soldier Svejk'. Even non-singers will be tempted to join in, such is the infectious spirit engendered!The food is excellent, the service superb, the entertainment (by the 'Svejk Duo') contagious and the visual setting is nothing less than stunning. To come here and experience some notable period Czech authenticity is well worth the effort and it might even serve as an introduction to world renown Czech Satirist Jaroslav Hasek's writings (and of course to 'The Good Soldier Svejk' himself). My own introduction to the 'Plzenska Beer Hall Restaurant' came in the course of a Danube Cruise this past October, which included a stopover of several days in this fabulously 'old European' city, and it remains as a highlight among the many excellent sights & experiences to be found in Prague (and there are indeed MANY) today.If you have traveled in Germany and Austria, but are somewhat new to the Czech Republic, this visit will be an experience to enjoy and treasure long afterwards. If you have selected the equally excellent Hotel Yasmin to stay at, you are very close by and well within a short walking distance to the Plzenska Beer Hall Restaurant, as well as historic Wenceslas Square, the Prague State Opera House and many other 'don't miss' Prague experiences (such as the internationally acclaimed City of Prague Philharmonic Orchestra).Prices at the Plzenska Beer Hall Restaurant are moderate, but the overall experience is utterly delightful! Don't miss the 'American bar' next door (in the same Prague Municipal House Hall basement) with its unique European Jugendstille decor!).

Art Nouveau. This is a perfect example of Art Nouveau. Our guide gave a definite insight of the two architects responsible for the attractive building. It is one of those buildings that has the "wow" factor.
Take a look inside out. Take 5 minutes to take a look at the building. There usually street performers outside. One of many incredible buildings.
Excellent visit. This is an excellent place to visit. The decorations on the inside are stunning. We attended an opera ballet concert there and greatly enjoyed it.

You must see it. If you are interested in art nouveau you definatelly see it inside .There are planty of wonderfull rooms and interiors.It is very unforgetable expierience and wonderfull travel in time!

Stunning. Beautiful building and stunning inside from what we saw - my friend and I bought tickets for opera/ballet evening, so we were directed upstairs to the room the orchestra were going to be performing in. Was an hour and half show, enjoyable and something different to do. Once it had finished we left, so I don't think we saw as much of the building as you were able to.
Beautiful venue for the Prague Symphony. We went to the smetana hall for the symphony and it was great. The architecture inside is gorgeous and the seats are comfortable.

A joy to behold. I love Art Nouveau and this place is just a delight. The outside is beautiful and you can spend ages gazing at the details. Inside is wonderful. Not all of it is open to the casual visitor, but what there is, is lovely. It is worth going into the restaurants and bars to see the decoration, though you are not allowed to take photos in there. We had coffee in the cafe, and the whole place is gracious and elegant. Do go and have a look,

Inhale some Prague history without being bored.. This building is important for many reasons and all became apparent during the 1 hour guided tour of it.The guide was a friendly lady with good English and managed to keep it interesting and informative and never even flirted with being boring. She certainly made the tour her own and our group of 15 people or so enjoyed the ride.Anyone a little interested in the rich diversity of Prague, the Czech republic and its most recent 100 years should put this on the list.History, politics, culture and arts all have a place in this story and this building is trying very hard to tell you all that is has witnessed. Listen to it carefully and you will find yourself richer than when you entered.
Just perfect!. What can i say?! Definitely must-go place! Beautiful store with a very interesting architecture and also very classy. The staff is very kind and very helpful! Just go!

Civilized lunch. A lovely place to stop off for a civilized lunch in lovely surroundings. The Art Deco surroundings definitely add that air of elegance and the waiters have old school charm. I had the fish platter & could not fault it, though the accompanying dry toast was a little unusual.

Nice building in a grayish square. Visited Prague mid Dec. 2015 all the streets decorated for the holidays and a festive atmosphere in the air. The Republic square was one of the less decorated places and in that square the Municipal House Hall was not decorated at all. The building is big and quite impressive from the outside, but less than other monuments in the old town of Prague. If you are near, go see it, but I wouldn't recommend making much efforts for it.

Lunch at Municipal House. Visited on rainy day at lunch time. The building was built as a meeting place for all classes. A high class restaurant, a middle class restaurant and an area for drinking downstairs in the basement. Even if you don't eat here it's worth poking your head in to look at the decor. Staff did not seem to mind people viewing, when we visited as part of a tour.Menu was acceptable in content and price, and the service was just about acceptable. The surrounding decor and ambience make the eating experience just a little bit difference. Being winter time there was not a problem getting a table at lunch, but I can believe that at busy times it might be a problem. With more than 60 or so tables, I guess the wait would not be too long.

Music from Hollywood. My partner and I watched an orchestra perform music from Hollywood here on the 18th December, fantastic. We were sat at the back and made no difference the music was sensational and the surroundings were spectacular.

Beautiful place. A great urban building, containing a concert hall (gorgeous but admittedly not with the best acoustics), museum wings, all sorts of halls for public and private functions, several restaurants, shops, and an underground bar and restaurant. This is how buildings should be built.

Beautiful. A beautiful building inside and out. Art Noveau tiling and metal work were gorgeous. the concert hall was a perfect venue for a Christmas concert. Tucked away in the basement were a traditional restaurant and a the Americany Bar. Small and cosy, staffed by pleasant and helpful young barren. Where better to enjoy a first taste of local wines as recommended by the bar man.

Lovely Hot Chocolate; Awful Service. We decided to pay a visit to the Art Deco style coffee shop for a hot chocolate after a day at the markets. It was quite busy when we arrived but we managed to find a table and ordered 2 hot chocolates from the waiter who seemed very impatient. Hot chocolates arrived quickly with a mini macaroon on the side, a very delicious extra.The building itself and the room the cafe is in is stunning, very 1930s Art Deco style, they still have a dessert trolley that visits all the tables offering a decent selection of intricate looking cakes. It's a lovely touch that adds to the atmosphere of a more glamorous era. However, when it came time to pay our bill we had a lot of trouble getting the attention of a waiter, when we did we were told we had to get the waiter who has originally served us; slightly inconvenient because he was having a in depth conversation with a table that had just arrived. Same thing happened when we came to pay our bill. It's a real shame the service was not up to the standard we were expecting as we'd be reluctant to return or recommend it on this basis.
Stunning. Absolutely loved this Art Deco building, it was perfect! The lift was stunning, it even had a sofa and an operator. There's the oldest bar in Prague downstairs too!Highly recommend
Another amazing building. Looked in one afternoon There are two restaurants here with lovely art deco features. Concerts are held here as well. Like many places in Prague, this is well worth a visit.
Morning coffee and cake. Best place to spend a morning looking at art deco coffee shop and drinking the hot apple with a cake from the cake trolley.
Beautiful, art nouveau building. Fabulous, original and beautiful building featuring original Art Nouveau features, a spectacular restaurant and cafe bar, a Czech restaurant and a concert hall.
Cake and Champagne. We visited the cafe for the most beautiful black Forrest gateaux and goes down well with Bohemian Brut. The Jazz band was very entertaining.
Beautiful building!. It is very beautiful both inside and outside. It would be great if you can catch a concert in the building too, there are several classical music concerts.

Beautiful building with a fantastic ambience. This building is amazing. The bar with samovar, mulled wine and every drink you can imagine was an experience in itself. Took us back in time.We saw a concert on the Saturday night (Strauss, Mozart, ballet and opera) in one of the smaller rooms. Talent of artistes - combined with the intimate surroundings - was simply phenomenal.You simply have to go!

Nice building. We visited the building last week - really nice architecture bar down int eh basement which to be honest was a little too smoky for us so we left and went to another bar - not sure why smoking is still allowed in doors here !

Nice building!. We walked around the building last weekend and enjoyed the views all around. It is definitively not as amazing looking as the astronomical clock or Charles bridge, but still totally worth it for a few pictures.

Opulent Art Nouveau. The Prague citizens needed to make sure they had an opulent municipal hall to compete with their neighbours. The mosaic inlay dome in the centre is a popular photo subject. There are two restaurants inside, both with art nouveau interiors, and worth splashing some cash to have a coffee and enjoy the interior.

Fabulous Art Nouveau Building. Beautiful building inside and out. Great architecture and art nouveau down to the door knobs. Lovely bar downstairs but bear in mind, like most bars, smoking is allowed. The restaurants on the ground floor are amazing to look at due to the decor. Saw a concert here which was well worth the very cheap entrance fee. Highly recommend and visit, a drink or a coffee and soak up the atmosphere.

Entertainment. Went here to listen to a classical concert , which was a nice hour of.evening entertainment. The building itself is Art Deco/ Nuevo and very interesting. There is a bar downstairs so if you don't want a concert you can just have a drink.

Superb Art Deco interior.. This is now a theatre with a bar (Ameriky Bar) and restaurant below and a cafe to the left and a posh restaurant to the right. All the rooms are fantastic and so are the stairs, hallways, even the ticket offices. For Art Deco lovers this is a must see building.
Beautiful. Could not believe how beautiful this building was. Could not get a good photo as work vans ect. outside and very busy. Pity.
Great example of old qorld architecture. As part of the hop on hop off us your we stopped here, actually walked here. After seeing all the other magnificent architecture this is a medium range place.

Like stepping back in time!. Fabulous building, we decided against dining and opted for coffee and cake, definitely a treat! Beautiful inside, was quite busy so service was a little slow but that is to be expected, would have loved to catch a concert but we didn't make it back in time.

Drinks. Not a bad place for a pit stop to have a drink and enjoy some people watching and the art deco interior which is really impressive.The desert trolley was being wheeled around and the contents looked really good but I doubt the waistline would thank you.Service is hit and miss.
Fantastic art nouveau building. Relatively ecently renovated building with fantastic art nouveau interior. Good, although expensive restaurant.

Historic building. Located at Náměstí Republiky 5, it has Art Nouveau façade with a large mural on the arch above the second floor balcony to the large dome that rests behind and above the arch. The interior includes many fine stained glass windows and paintings and plenty of history.

Caters for everyone! Classical music, cake and coffee or the American bar. We called into this magnificent building for coffee and cake and booked to come back for a classical concert that evening. The concert was one hour long - just long enough to persuade my husband to attend (not being a musical person!). We had started the evening with a cocktail in the American bar in the basement and finished with another after the concert. The American bar is downstairs and very atmospheric done out in 1920's style (It opened in 1912). Next door to it was a huge restaurant/beer hall which sounded great fun and had we not eaten we might have been tempted to join in as everyone seemed to be having a great time. A real fun place to visit.

Spectacular Czech Art Nouveau. This building is so beautiful, it's a must for anyone interested in Art Nouveau and/or architecture. Make sure you go downstairs to the gorgeous bar: you actually can start to believe that you are living in that period of time.
Spectacular!. It's an amazing building, especially in the evening since it's wonderfully lit and makes you speechless by its beauty :)
Great example of Czech Art Nouveau. If you want to see great example of Czech Art Nouveau, must go there, walk around and have goffe in the stylish restaurant.
Gorgeous. If you like the Art Nouveau period this will blow your socks off. Go down into the basement and treat yourself to a genuine Czech lunch. It is Stunning

"a beautfiul location to enjoy coffee and cake!". I wanted to visit one of the old-style Prague coffee houses and the café at Obecni Dum did not disappoint. Wonderful Art Deco décor, chandeliers etc. and very attentive traditional waiter service. My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed the cakes we chose.
Smashing. First visited this place after watching Michael Portillo`s railway journey TV show, to be honest before that we had no idea. Lovely place to visit and have a drink or cake or both!

Excellent Concert!!!!. October 25th, we attended a concert billed as 'The Best of Mozart & Strauss with Ballet and Singers'. This was in Smetana Hall, a beautiful Art Nouveau structure, within The Municipal House. The acoustics were brilliant. The musicians, dancers and singers were so very, very wonderful!!!
Fine Building. We saw an Art Deco exhibition here and were rewarded by hearing the orchestra rehearse for an evening performance. Worth your trouble for the architecture.

Unique Building of the golden age of Art Nouveau. The Municipal House is an elegant building located near Prague old town area. The building is one of the most beautiful buildings in Prague. There is an amazing concert hall that hosts performances venues for classic music. There are two excellent restaurants in at the ground level with amazing atmosphere and excellent food. Must see in Prague for dining and watching performance.

Prices but nice. I attended A Hollywood movie music night - very enjoyable but overpriced. €36 paid for 60 mins concert - dearest ticket €52. In Dublin the most this would have cost in Concert Hall would be about €40 with a better orchestra and for 2 hours.
Don't miss this building. An Art Nouveau lovers delight, inside and out. The restaurants are a must visit. Excellent food at reasonable prices (special tourist menu).

A unique venue. The Obecni dum is a unique location for many reasons, and a must-see in Prague. From its balcony, the formation of Czechoslovakia was announced by President Masaryk, the Lord Mayor's room is a stunning display of the power of Alfons Mucha's design and sense of color, proportion and extreme talent, Like Frank Lloyd Wright, Mucha designed everything--the furniture, the material, the carpet, the fixtures, etc. This room alone is a tour-de-force that cannot be described in words alone.

Concert Central. We went to a lovely concert in this venue. The restaurant downstairs offers local fare at a great price with fabulous variety. The building itself is beautiful and the concert was memorable.

Don't miss it!. This building is so beautiful. It's full of elegant Art Nouveau details, inside and out. It houses performances venues and two restaurants, as well as tours, but you can also just go in and walk around part of it for free. I went here almost every day when we were in Prague, and noticed something new and exquisite every time. We ate a small meal in the cafe. It was overpriced, but worth it to sit there and marvel at the decor.

Very informative visit. We had a guided tour lasting one hour, the guide spoke English beautifully and we learnt so much about this beautiful building. We also learnt a lot about the history of the Czech Republic.

Extremely fine example of Art Nouveau.... I think it's certainly one of the most beautiful buildings in Prague. I did not go inside, but I spent some time admiring the outside. It works the greatest artists, sculptors and painters from the beginning of the last century, including work by Alfons Mucha ... First on the list of my tour at the next visit to Prague.

Historical Art Nouveau building. Really gorgeous. Just stand outside and stare at it. I ate in the downstairs restaurant which was excellent. I also visited the Art Nouveau exhibition which was pretty good but not outstanding and went on the tour of the building. For me the highlight of the tour was the mayor's room.

Mesmerizing musical experience. A beautiful building where one of the agents convinced us to buy the tickets ! It was the money worth spent and we thoroughly enjoyed the concert ! The lighting and the acoustics were excellent. We separated from our tour bus, but the tram station nearby is very convenient.

Sensational Music experience. We saw the National Czech Syphony Orchestra in a sentaional experience in 4th November Both the acoustic and the building were outstandingI reccomend it to all music fans and be sure to combine it with some perfect pastry in the cafe inside the buulding with perfect cakes.In the late November Andreas Bocelli will give a concert in Municipal house and if you are in Prague do not lose the experience

Nice looking place. We had to take a very long walk to pick up our tour bus, that's another story, Anyway a tour guide brought us out and we walked past this place, most impressive looking building, I couldn't think of what design it was, but as another reviewer put it, Art nouveau! That's the one! Lovely looking anyway!

A music venue and restaurants. My preference is the restaurant in the basement of the building... Not elaborate , but good solid Czech menu and pricing that is a bit lower than the others in the building. again close to Marriott & Hilton hotels , Less than a block away.
A "must visit". A fascinating building, worth taking a conducted tour, with concert halls, restaurants and beautiful architecture. We enjoyed a teatime chamber concert. Don't miss it!
Art nouveau architecture to the max. The exterior and interior of the building will charm you. If you wish to eat at the restaurant downstairs, you must make reservations. They are always full.

Don't miss the afternoon tour. This is the most significant art nouveau building in Prague. There are somethings you can see on your own, but if you want to see the interiors and learn about its architecture, don't miss the roughly 2-hour guided tour. This enables you to see many of the salons and their art work that were designed by a number of well known artists. Your final stop is the downstairs bar which is an excellent spot for an afternoon cocktail.

An amazing building. We visited the Municipal house every day of our trip. The interior is breathtaking - a real art nouveau treasure. The three restaurants are all worth a visit. If you keep away from the wine list the food in the fine dining restaurant is fantastic. The basement traditional local restaurant has enormous portion at a good price. The exhibition of art nouveau is well worth a visit. I think it is certainly one of the most beautiful buildings in Prague.

Best Art Noveau architecture in town. There are a lot of things to see in this building, which represents Czech Art Noveau at it's best. If you are in a hurry just take a coffee with cake in the cafeteria on ground floor ( unfortunately smoking) or go to the basement restaurant to admire the interior while having lunch non-smoking. Take a peak at the American Bar while downstairs. The most elegant restaurant is French and on the ground floor, where you can also find at the back a shop selling museum pieces. This was a free tour, but there is one more thorough, which can be booked and it shows also the frescos in the former municipal offices.

Beautiful Art Deco Building.. Beautiful building inside and out. Did not take the tour or do any of the concerts but was able to go inside and look around the gift shop and restaurant. On my list of things to do next time!Although I have said this is free to the public, you can only access certain areas. There is a tour available if you wish to see more.
Take the tour. This is a beautiful, ornate building, beautiful outside and inside both. So be sure to see the outside, but the interior tour is well worth it.

Another attractive building near the old town. I didn't go inside, but spent some time admiring the exterior of this interesting structure located near the old town. There are so many fascinating buildings in Prague from different stages in history, this one is worth a stop for some pics.

a must if you like art deco!. The one hour guided tour takes you to beautiful rooms otherwise not open to the public. Suggest also going to one of the many concerts. If budget permits the fine dining restaurant has a set menu which is good value for money and the place is absolutely fantastic decor-wise. American Bar on the ground floor is also worht a visit.

Lovely Art Nouveau Building with fantastic cakes. We had lunch here as it such a lovely place to go. There is not much choice for vegetarians but I really like their ragout and hazelnut cake. There is a baby changing mat in the ladies toilet which is rare in Prague.

Great cake. We visited the cafe inside this stunning Art Nouveau building for coffee and cake. The cafe is lovely, the coffee is good ( one of the best we had) and the cake was delicious. I had a cherry cake and my husband had a chocolate cake.Both are recommended.Afterwards we walked downstairs to the American bar to look around and enjoy the architecture.Well worth a visit

A pleasant atmosphere. Very central and a nice way to indulge in cafe culture.The cakes and coffee are not expensive and the art nouveau interior is attractive.To relax from sightseeing for half an hour here is one of the many joys of visiting Prague.
Nice building . It is near pallidum shopping mall and it is the entrance to the way to the old town I think an opera show is there now . All touristic tour you can book from there

Great Art Deco Hall. Great architecture, and a great contrast to the surrounding ancient and modern buildings. There are several interesting things to do in the building, but the building itself is worth your attention.

Art Nouveau heaven. It's worth coming here for coffee and cake in the cafe but you should also explore further if you're an art nouveau fan. Search out the American bar in the basement for a cocktail in authentic surroundings.

Amazing place. I was in Prague on a school trip when I visited the Municipal House Hall: it's an amazing building; the reastaurant is furnished with pieces from the 20s - it's like a dive into the past!

Top Art Nouveau building must see in Prague!. This building is the most beautiful art nouveau building in Prague including both exterier and interier. It was connected with establishment of the first Czechoslovak republic in 1918, so you will find a piece of recent history except for beautiful interiers inside. Part of the building is also cafe Obecni dum, french restaurant, American bar and typical Czech restaurant, all of them in Art Nouveau, so you will enjoy your visit every single minute.

Beautiful restaurant one level down, very good food and great atmosphere.. Possibly best for early evening dinner as it gets a bit crowded later on but a gem of a place. We have eaten there in successive years and it remains a prize venue. The peripatetic musicians will conjure up a melody to suit your ethnicity. They knew more of the words to "My Bonnie Lies over the Ocean" than I do. The food is fabulous and very reasonably priced for the centre of Prague.
Musical history. very nice place for who has no children to have a good time it was not suitable for me with my daughter to stay there.

One of the art nouveau's most impressive buildings in Prague.. A must-see, with the stunning interiors remaining intact with their murals my Munch and incredible light fittings. You can wander in for a quick look, take a tour or enjoy a drink or meal in the cafe/bars and restaurants. Well-floodlit at night, the square outside is a popular meeting place.
Amazing building , fixtures and fittings.. try the old bar downstairs, cocktails are fab, the restaurant looked amazing, all in the art nouveaux style, stunning.
Wow!. What a beautiful, opulent building! The architecture and elaborate designs on the facade as well as inside are truly a sight to behold. Be sure to eat at the restaurant if you can!

Fabulous. This is a "must" for any visit to Prague. The quality of the decor is truly amazing. You must take the tour of the facility to get to see most of it, but the price is low so it's well worth it. The guide gave an excellent history of the city as well as of the building Also you get 2-for-1 cocktails in the amazing American Bar at the end.

Beuatiful building and amazing restaurant. I was here for the first time in 2009, and I came back now in 2015 because I had such a vivid memory of it. The building itself is amazing, a jewel of art nouveau, with stained glass windows, and every detail is a work of art, from the lamps to the door knobs and the staircases. And above all, the restaurant downstairs in the basement is amazing. Really good food to reasonable prices, in a beautiful setting. The café upstairs is also very good, a beautiful room with crystal chandeliers and a pianist playing while you eat. It makes you feel like you're in a movie, or like you're back in 1920. A must when you're in Prague.

The Municipal House Hall is a must see in Prague. A great place for a dinner before taking in a musical concert.. The Municipal House is a beautifully ornate building, centrally located in downtown Prague. The building is home to a wonderful concert house. The acoustics were quite good although the seating is a bit austere. The musical venue is advertised just outside the main doors. While waiting for your concert you can dine in the Kavarna Obecni Dum located to the left of the box office entrance. Local dishes, well prepared, and the restaurant is as beautiful as the concert house.The Municipal House is best viewed at night. Bright lights illuminate the front facade as seen here. Truly a must see while in the city.

Massive building with art nouveau. This is a very large building with some great architecture and art nouveau . We also attended a one hour concert there which was very good (1600 Koruna for two) . The most well known tunes of many very famous composers were played for just over an hour . We also stated for an early dinner in the same building - the food was not bad . A must see in Praha.

Great building. Terrible service for tourists. This building is absolutely stunning from every angle you look at it. It’s beautiful during the day and at night. It’s an art noveaux building that has 2 restaurants in the ground floor, another one in the basement and the magnificent American Bar also in the basement. There are also 5 or 6 music halls inside this building. There are classical music concerts every night. You can also take a tour to the building during the day. I tried to go to one of the concerts but the answers and service I got at the box office was so bad that I turned around and went away. Did not want to spend a single penny in a place where tourists are treated in such appalling way. It’s a shame because I really wanted to listen to some music there.

A highlight of our visit!. I mentioned to my airbnb host that I was interested in going to the Municipal House to see its Art Noveau interior. The host gushed about it and said that it was one of his favorite places in Prague. His "thumbs up" worked out well for me, because my husband likes Art Noveau and he was a bit tired of castle and church interiors after almost 3 weeks in Europe.We went on the tour, which I think is the only way to see the building unless you are attending a special event. The tour was well worth it. Every room was stunning. The lighting, decor, and painted ceilings are gorgeous. Some of the ceilings were painted by Alfons Mucha, so if you are a fan of his, do not miss this tour. (Then head across the bridge the next day to see the Slav Epic.)We also paid to see the current Art Noveau exhibit. It was interesting, but I've seen a few Art Noveau exhibits in the past, and this one did not blow me away. So if you are pressed for time, or your feet are tired, I would take the tour of the building and skip the exhibit. Or spend that time going to see the Slav Epic.Our tour tickets included a 2 for 1 beer at the Ameriky Bar on the lower level. If we had been ready for a beer, that would have been a beautiful place to have one. Stop in to see the bar even if you don't decide to sit down and have a drink. If you don't have time for a tour - too bad for you! But consider visiting the Ameriky Bar or one of the two other eating establishments so that you can dine in the Art Noveau splendor.

The most beutiful Art Nouveax building I've ever seen. This building is unbelievable how a building like this ghas survived is a mystery to me. its stunning both inside and out the tiles inside are amazing you must have a meal here. The rooms with the chandeliers are breath taking the meal wasn't bad either

Stunning example of Art Nouveau. I was unaware of the central role of Prague in the Art Nouveau movement. But after visiting the Obecni Dum it is very clear the pivotal role Prague played. This is a stunning example of Art Nouveau and I would highly recommend a short visit to anyone in the area.
Spectacular Art Nouveau architecture. The guided tour of the Municipal House is a must for anyone interested in architecture - an amazing building.

Unbelievable!. Easily the highlight of our trip to Prague - the whole place is dripping with Art Nouveau decadence - the cafe, restaurant, American Bar - and that's before you start on the tour of the building, the essential Art Nouveau collection (borrowed from the Decorative Arts Museum which is closed until 2017 - but only on display at the Municipal House until the end of 2016), and also the Blanka Matragi dress exhibition - wow.

A gem of art nouveau style. if you go for the Art nouveau example par excellence, this concert hall is the place to visit. it has beeen preserved beautifully and holds some wonderful concerts and exhibits.
Magnificent building. A must see place not only from outside, but from inside. Tours are available.There are concerts taking place in the Municipal House, which are unforgettable.
Easy to miss, but don't!. This was one of our most interesting visits in Prague. The guide was interesting and informative and the building is an art nouveau masterpiece.
Basement restaurant is a great place of lunch.. Great food in a wonderfully decorated basement with art deco tiled walls. Generous portions and a relaxed canteen atmosphere.

Stunning building. Visited here for one of the classical concerts. Was held in a side room of the main hall. Although it was an excellent concert by the 'Prague Music Chamber Orchestra' and 'The Best of Classics' was just that, considering other venues in the city, this was overpriced (1,000 kc) and only an hour. Don't miss the bar or restaurant in the basement - excellent!

The Cafe in Municipal House is wonderful. By far my favourite cafe in Prague. A really beautiful cafe in one of the most interesting buildings in Prague. It is the place to come for breakfast, or mid-morning coffee with superb cake. The restaurant looked rather staid so we did not try it.

Go back to a different era. An art-deco building that is a must see for lovers of 1900-1910. The top floor gallery of art-deco posters and furniture is well worth the admission and even the lift/elevator is a joy but the walk down via the stair case is better.

The best Art Nouveau building. At Prague center ( The Republic sq, ) is one of the most beautiful buildings in Europe.
It was never used as a "town hall", but built by the municipality as a music center.
Now days you can visit the place and hear a good concert.
The coffee place is very nice but you can skip the French restaurant.

Beautiful building. This building is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city. Recommended to visit during the day.
tours are on the high side ( I did not attend one).

See It All and Save $$ with Combination Admission. You can visit the public spaces here and enjoy looking at some of the stunning art nouveau decor, but it's only the tip of the iceberg. To see it all, buy the combination admission for 450 CZK - $18.80. That modest sum will cover 3 things:1. one-hour English/Czech guided tour to the splendid non-public areas including the Semetana Concert Hall (where you may even glimpse a rehearsal of the Prague Symphony, as we did). 2. entry to the "Vital Art Nouveau 1900" exhibition, a luxuriously wide-ranging exploration of the nouveau aesthetic, from decorative and fine arts to film and photography to haute couture gowns and accessories.3. entry to the "Timeless" exhibition featuring gowns designed by Blanka Mitragi -- each one a work of highly original and eye-catching art. These things are not to be missed if you want to see the beauty and to feel the pulse of Prague's amazing artistic and cultural heritage. See my pictures from the tour and the Vital Art Nouveau exhibition. Unfortunately, photography was not permitted at the "Timeless" exhibition due to the delicacy of the fabrics. But you can take pictures of a few of Mitragi's gowns in Muncipal House's display windows, outside, or you can buy a catalogue at the exhibition (not in English, however).It's best to arrive early -- ticket office opens at 10 AM but people line up from 9 or 9:30 -- and to make sure you know where to meet for the tour and where to find the two exhibits (second floor, up the main staircase, but signs are scarce and staff whom we met did not speak English, so we had to rely on Russian to find our way, even then not easy). After you're set, do take a stroll through the public areas, especially the lower level that has some beautiful tile work on the walls and gilded metalwork enclosing the art nouveau elevator. If the hour is right, do stop by the American Bar, one of the more evocative watering holes in Prague, even if the bartenders are not masters of the cocktail: but you can find something pleasant to drink while drinking in the atmosphere.Municipal House is the home of the Prague Symphony Orchestra, which has four performances scheduled for the famous Smetana Hall in December (9, 10, 16 and 17) for about $20 a ticket: a real bargain, the more so because of the charming intimacy of the hall. We took in the opening performance of the fall season and it was splendid, with some newer, trendier selections along with Dvorak's classic New World Symphony. The experience was sublime and unforgettable. There are other performances as well, so that on any given day you'll probably find an opportunity to enjoy mostly classical music in the great hall. Check in advance and buy tickets early, especially as the holiday season approaches. It's great to see the hall on the tour, but to be there for an actual performance is wonderful to the nth degree.One final note on saving $$. If you are only interested in the guided tour, you will get a 15 percent discount if you present the Prague card. It costs about $52 for 2 days, $63 for 3 days and $73 for 4 days and it covers public transportation from the date/time of first use, gives free admission to many sights and museums, and discounts on others, such as the very popular Mucha Museum. I do not believe it offers a discount on the already discounted combination admission to Municipal House, but you might check on that.If you plan to visit many artistic, cultural, historical or tourist attractions, it probably pays to buy the card. You can get it at the airport, at the Prague City Center and other locations around town. Prague is a great place to visit. IMHO the Municipal House is the best of the best. Do stop by, even if only to visit the public spaces, including the famous bar or one of the two very good cafes, where you can also feast your eyes on original art nouveau decor. There's also a pleasant snack bar combined with ticket office and gift shop that has a nice range of art-nouveau-themed offerings.

Must see in Prague . This is a must see in Prague when visiting this city, and if you like art nouveau should be the first thing to see. The guided tour worth every penny as you can hear about the history of this place and have the opportunity to see the rooms. The room painted by Mucha is fabulous, unique as a jewellery. I'm sure a concert in Smetana Hall it is something.
beautiful building. The building is very nice, old stil building with a lot of decoration elements, in the night with lights it is even more pretty

Sublime. I love anything art nouveau so this was a must see for me. Didn't take the tour but went to see the exhibition on the second floor of Czech art nouveau objects and clothing. Even my sceptical husband loved it. Gorgeous clothes, posters, jewellery and even furniture from this period. Had a coffee in the cafe on the ground floor to finish off. Perfect morning for me

Forget about now, immerse yourself in the magical beauty of Art Nouveau. Visiting Obecni dum was one of the highlights of our recent vacation in Prague. Our whole group is Czech in origin; my husband and I live abroad though; our moms travelling with us still live in the Czech Republic.I have always known of Obecni dum, visited many beautiful exhibitions and attended wonderful concerts there, this was the first time for all of us to take the guided house tour and it was just splendid, the interiors are so beautiful, it doesn't matter whether one likes history or design or art - or not, because one looks around and sees amazingly beautiful details, such as air vents (some of them done in gold and all in intricate detailing), furniture, stained glass, wood works, light fixtures - one just appreciates the craftsmanship ( and I for one appreciate that the restoration of this house that was done in the 1990s was done so superbly that today we can admire all those details). For such a big house, I had a feeling of incredible warmth - it felt really nice and "cozy" to be in those interiors.......maybe that is the secret of this art nouveau style.I also want to mention the exhibitions going on in Obecni dum till the end of this year that are really worth seeing and a combined ticket can be purchased that works out better pricewise. There is Timeless, the fashion art of Blanka Matragi, a Czech designer who lives in Beirut, Lebanon, and designs mostly for the aristocracy of the Middle East, I was awed by the beautiful embroidery and beading and where she gets inspiration for her designs. There is Secese, Art Nouveau exhibition on the upper floor that shows a little bit of everything from this style - furniture, posters, clothes, glassware and ceramics, but also prints and paintings and explains the main motifs behind art nouveau. And in the hall in front of this exhibition there is a small exhibit of life and costumes of Jarmila Novotna, a major opera diva of Czech origin, who sang in all the biggest venues of the world and made the Metropolitan Opera in New York her home, mostly due to the difficult Czech and European historical events of the 20th century. The main dress of the exhibit was made by the most important Czech fashion house of the pre WWII era, the fashion house Podolska and it is for the first time the public can admire it from so close up, it is a special loan of the Metropolitan.While seeing these exhibitions, one gets to see other spaces of the Municipal House, but don't forget, the cloak room and the toilets are also worth visiting - the whole hose is just beautiful.

Unique and pretty. We took the tour and really liked the sequence of fancy rooms. It was a nice little side-trip, on the way to the Mucha museum from St. Jacob's. The tour guide told us of the various historical events that had happened there, which made it more interesting than just looking at the rooms would have been.

An elegant building. Obecni Dum or Municipal House is an example of one of the finest Art Nouveau Buildings in Europe. There used to be a Royal Palace here till the end of the nineteenth century. This building was completed in 1912 and immediately became the pride of the Republic Square. It gained further prominence when proclamation of the independent state of Czechoslovakia was presented here on the 28th October 1918. The exterior of this building is adorned with beautiful stone filigree, gold embellishments, stained glass windows and artistic frescoes. The interior is decorated with frescoes by Karl Sillar, marble staircases, classy chandeliers and elegant plaster work. The Smetana Concert Hall is a masterpiece in it's own right. It is the venue where the Czech National Symphony Orchestra performs. The building also houses two restaurants, one American bar and a museum.

Amazingly Beautiful. One of the most beautiful buildings in Prague. One can gaze at it for hours for its sheer beauty. The building houses a concert hall apart from several restaurants and cafes. The building is located next to the Powder Tower. A must see site in Prague.

An iconic element of Prague's landmarks!. We chose Municipal Hall to have a meal celebrating our son's 21st birthday. Whilst generally finding Czech food a challenge in it's less spiced style than our preference, the choice of food was pleasing and the standard was reasonably high. The service was the outstanding element of our experience, our waiter was attentive and nothing was too much trouble. To be able to sit outside and drink in Prague' s undeniable charm was unforgettable at this splendid building.

Fantastic food. We loved returning to Municipal House All time and time again. We had dinner, late lunches, tea time, late late dinner, afternoon snack... we just kept going back there any time we were near the location. They have a meat and cheese plate that is to die for. The tea is wonderful. The desserts are very good. We were lucky to get a table for 'tea time' late one afternoon. However, we mostly ate in the outside cafe section because we loved to people watch. This place is one that we will return to when next we return to Prague. It just leaves an unforgettable memory, and I will be forever thankful that I got to experience this. Don't miss it.

Tour this Art Nouveau concert hall, then have lunch in the Kavarna restaurant on ground floor.. This year, the Art Nouveau treasures are on exhibit here (ticketed) whilst the Museum of Decorative Arts is being rebuilt/renovated. Take a tour of the building too, Art Nouveau glory. Have lunch (discounted if you have a tour ticket) in the Kavarna ground floor restaurant. 230 - 290 Kr for 3 course tourist lunch on weekdays!
Attractive Municipal House. Great view of the building from outside. It's next to the Powder tower. The detail of the building and the color of the painting is beautiful.
Wow. This building is one of the most beautiful I've ever seen. So ornate, with so much detail you'll be staring at it for ages

A stunner. Take the tour of the building. It is art nouveau at its finest. Every room on the tour is decorated spectacularly, from the walls, to the curtains, to the ceilings, and the furniture. If you love Art Nouveau, this place is heaven
Beautiful Building!. Beautiful art nouveau structure, a must visit while in Prague, especially if you are able to attend a concert in Smetana Hall.

Go inside. I just wish that the architects of Sweden could build houses like this. It is one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. The art shop inside has nice gifts as well. Have a beer in the bar in the basement if you have the the time.
Mozart's Requiem - great rendition. Saw a wonderful rendition of Mozart's Requiem. Brilliantly performed in a wonderfully ornate location.

Breathtaking Art Nouveau masterpiece. In a city of beautiful buildings this is one of the very best. An incredible art nouveau masterpiece, with more perfectly restored detail than you can properly take in. The tour is the best way to see it, with admittance to otherwise inaccessible rooms. It takes about an hour. The box office for tours is through the foyer and on your left. There are several tours in English through the day. Photos are allowed. There are restaurants, a bar and cafe in the building. We ate in the cafe and it was delicious, slightly overpriced, but a beautiful setting. There are toilets available in the building.

fabulous building. We love this building. We prefer to go to concerts in the hall rather than take the tour, as the interval period provides ample opportunity to enjoy the architecture and design of the various rooms in the building. The concerts are also very good vfm.
lovely art deco building.. A must see in Prague if you like art deco design,go inside and see ,its lovely,very busy so may not get a table,but it is well worth it.

Fabulous buidling. Tour well worth taking.. One of our favorite places in Prague. We almost didn't take the tour but were glad we did. Highly recommended. Have a meal or snack in the beautiful ground floor restaurant.

great art deco building. We loved this building. We went on the tour and the guide was very informative. The architecture is art deco and more modern than most buildings. There were many rooms to visit and each room was different.

Walk by. Very pretty building that hosts a lot of musical events. We never went inside but the outside was beautiful. One local said the restaurant on 1st floor is to be avoided because food isn't good so we never tried it.
